json.companyDescription:
Animaj is a next-generation media company that brings high-quality and inspiring brands to kids and families worldwide.

We acquire and transform high-quality IPs into multi-platform franchises, using a digital-first and AI-driven approach. 

Our content, produced independently, aims to inspire children to dream, explore, and create.

json.title: Accelerator Data & AI Engineering Lead (Paris)
json.descriptionHtml:
Le contenu du poste est libellé en anglais car il nécessite de nombreuses interactions avec nos filiales à l’international, l'anglais étant la langue de travail.

This job offer is accessible to all, regardless of gender.

Job title: Data Engineering Lead

  • Location: Paris
  • Hybrid: M-W onsite

About The Job

At Sanofi, we’re committed to providing the next-gen healthcare that patients and customers need. It’s about harnessing data insights and leveraging AI responsibly to search deeper and solve sooner than ever before.

Join our AI Workflow Engineering team as a Data Engineering Lead and you can help make it happen.

About Sanofi

We’re an R&D-driven, AI-powered biopharma company committed to improving people’s lives and delivering compelling growth. Our deep understanding of the immune system – and innovative pipeline – enables us to invent medicines and vaccines that treat and protect millions of people around the world. Together, we chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives.

The products you will work on

You will play a key leadership role across our AI Workflow data products, specifically supporting the Source to Pay reimagination for buying and the streamlining of Sanofi knowledge and resolution for service management.

These Products Aim To

  • Automate and optimize AI-driven workflows across Sanofi, including procurement and support
  • Enable seamless deployment of GenAI and agentic systems through robust, scalable data pipelines and system integrations architectures

Main Responsibilities

  • Lead the design, implementation, and delivery of data pipelines, datamarts and AI workflows, ensuring scalability, resilience, and compliance with Sanofi’s standards
  • Work closely with business and product stakeholders within the AI Workflow domain to understand requirements and translate them into technical architectures and deliverables
  • Collaborate with Data Architects and Software Engineers to design, build, and maintain datamarts, models, and integrations in Snowflake, leveraging DBT, Airflow, and Python for automation and orchestration
  • Define, enforce, and continuously improve DataOps and MLOps practices, including CI/CD with GitHub Actions and infrastructure management using Terraform on AWS
  • Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to a small team of engineers, fostering a culture of accountability and technical excellence
  • Ensure high data quality and observability through automated testing, validation, and monitoring processes
  • Collaborate with AI Workflow teams to integrate GenAI, RAGs, and Agentic AI components into production workflows
  • Stay current with Sanofi standards, industry practices, and emerging technologies, ensuring the AI Workflow ecosystem remains at the forefront of innovation

About You

You are a dynamic and hands-on Data Engineering lead who combines technical depth with leadership maturity, you enjoy leading small, high-performing teams while staying close to code and architecture decisions. You’re passionate about designing systems that make AI workflows reliable, scalable, and impactful for Sanofi’s enterprise mission.

Key Technical Requirements & Qualifications

  • Strong experience leading end-to-end data engineering projects from design to production deployment
  • Proven experience with Snowflake, Airflow, DBT, Python, AWS, Terraform, and GitHub Actions
  • Good knowledge of SQL and relational databases technologies/concepts
  • Proven ability to define and enforce data and MLOps standards (CI/CD, observability, lineage, reproducibility)
  • Experience in building and maintaining data pipelines, datamarts, and data models at enterprise scale
  • Practical understanding of GenAI, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines, and Agentic AI integration
  • Strong collaboration with cross-functional teams — Product, Data Architecture, and AI Engineering
  • Ability to work within regulated environments (data privacy, compliance, cybersecurity) is a plus

Soft And Behavioral Skills

  • Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
  • Strong leadership and mentorship skills, with the ability to inspire and elevate junior engineers
  • Excellent communication, both written and verbal, able to translate technical concepts for diverse stakeholders
  • Service-oriented mindset and collaborative spirit
  • Self-motivated, proactive, and able to drive initiatives independently
  • Analytical and structured problem-solver with a delivery focus

Your Background

  • 6-8 years of experiences in a data team as Data Engineer
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Engineering, or relevant field
  • Experience in the healthcare industry is a strong plus

Why choose us?

  • Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
  • Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally
  • Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact
  • Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what’s never-been-done-before. You’ll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people’s lives? Let’s Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary – together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

@Accelerator

nullToujours Progresser. Découvrir l’Extraordinaire.

Rejoignez Sanofi et entrez dans une nouvelle ère de la science – où votre parcours peut être aussi transformateur que le travail que nous accomplissons. Nous investissons en vous pour que vous alliez plus loin, accélériez votre réflexion et accomplissiez ce qui n’a jamais été fait auparavant. Vous contribuerez à repousser les limites, à bousculer les conventions et à concevoir des solutions plus intelligentes pour les communautés que nous servons. Prêt·e à poursuivre les miracles de la science et à améliorer la vie des gens ? Poursuivons le progrès et découvrons l’extraordinaire – ensemble.

Chez Sanofi, nous croyons dans l’égalité des chances, sans distinction de race, de couleur, d’ascendance, de religion, de sexe, d’origine, d’orientation sexuelle, d’âge, de citoyenneté, d’état civil, de handicap, d’identité de genre ou de tout autre critère protégé par la loi.

We are an R&D driven, AI-powered biopharma company committed to improving people’s lives and delivering compelling growth. 

We apply our deep understanding of the immune system to invent medicines and vaccines that treat and protect millions of people around the world, with an innovative pipeline that could benefit millions more. Our team is guided by one purpose: we chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives; this inspires us to drive progress and deliver positive impact for our people and the communities we serve, by addressing the most urgent healthcare, environmental, and societal challenges of our time.

json.title: Product Strategy Analyst
json.descriptionHtml:
Product Strategy Analyst – AI Workflows

Location: Paris

Work setup: Hybrid (60% office, 40% remote)

Type: Permanent, full time


Coders Connect is partnering with Sanofi to support the growth of their AI Workflow Accelerator in Paris, a forward-thinking product hub focused on reimagining how work gets done through AI and automation.


This is a chance to join one of Sanofi’s most innovative digital product teams, where AI is used to simplify complex workflows and create impact at scale. The products you help shape will reach more than 50,000 Sanofi employees globally.


As a Product Strategy Analyst, you will work side by side with a Product Owner and a cross-functional team to design, build, and improve intelligent workflows that deliver measurable business value. It is a hands-on role with strong exposure to AI, product strategy, and agile delivery, offering a clear path to grow into a full Product Owner position.


What you will do

• Support the Product Owner in defining and maintaining the product roadmap and priorities

• Help facilitate discovery workshops with senior stakeholders and translate discussions into actionable backlog items

• Contribute to workflow design and configuration within the product platform

• Track, measure, and communicate the impact of product decisions

• Take an active part in agile ceremonies and sprint planning, ensuring clarity and alignment across the team

• Work in a fast-moving, iterative environment, with quarterly demos to Sanofi’s Executive Committee


About you

You bring energy, curiosity, and structure to everything you do. You have worked on digital products and want to accelerate your path into full product ownership. You thrive in a high-visibility, fast-paced environment and enjoy learning how AI can make business processes smarter and more human.


You will likely have

• Experience as a junior product owner, product analyst, business analyst, or consultant within digital or data-driven environments

• Understanding of agile delivery, roadmap planning, and product lifecycle fundamentals

• Strong analytical mindset and ability to translate business needs into clear product requirements

• Excellent communication skills in English (you will work daily with global stakeholders, particularly in the US and Canada)

• Curiosity about AI tools and automation, and eagerness to learn how to apply them in product development

• Motivation to grow, take ownership, and contribute actively to product outcomes

What makes this opportunity unique

• Join a team building agentic AI solutions at global scale

• Contribute to a product that will impact over 50,000 users across the organisation

• Work in an environment that values curiosity, initiative, and learning

• Be part of a fast-moving product track where your work translates into visible outcomes every quarter

• Grow your career towards Product Ownership, learning directly from experienced product leaders


Why join Sanofi

Sanofi is an R&D-driven, AI-powered biopharma company focused on improving lives and driving meaningful growth. The AI Workflow Accelerator embodies this ambition by using data, automation, and AI to reshape how teams collaborate and make decisions worldwide.


You will join a diverse, international, and forward-thinking community where ideas matter and learning never stops.


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

json.companySlogan: Coders Connect 💙 global 🌐 technology recruitment partner for start-ups 🦄 & scale-ups 🚀
json.companyDescription:
Coders Connect was formed from a technology community that has a focus on Software Engineering, Data Engineering, DevOps, QA Automation and Data Science. We provide a full hiring lifecycle experience. Everything from talent identification to offer management and most importantly, onboarding to aftercare and satisfaction - with everything in between.

Coders Connect started out as a dev community and now we are brilliantly placed to tap into some of the richest dev hot-spots. We continue to grow in our constantly evolving marketplace. We have broadened our vision and increased our capabilities to add more value to our communities.

Our tech communities are strongest in Software Engineering, Data Engineering, DevOps, QA Automation and Data Science. Need a change? Need talent? Our communities grow every day, our ability to deliver quality at speed is something that has proven valuable to many leading tech firms and technologists worldwide.

json.title: Test Automation Engineer
json.descriptionHtml:
At Sogeti, we believe the best is inside every one of us. Whether you are early in your career or at the top of your game, we’ll encourage you to fulfill your potential to be better. Through our shared passion for technology, our entrepreneurial culture , and our focus on continuous learning, we’ll provide everything you need to do your best work and become the best you can be.  

Sogeti

As Test Automation Engineer, you are involved in the automated verification and validation of products made by engineers in a development process. Your technical and professional knowledge of Test Automation, programming, test environments and methodologies is solid. With your knowledge and experience with one or more test tools and test techniques, you can independently design and execute test automation solutions. You follow the latest developments in your field and you know what is going on.

Job Description

VOTRE RÔLE, VOTRE AVENIR

En tant que testeur automaticien / testeuse automaticienne, vous interviendrez dans un environnement agile sur l’ensemble des aspects liés aux métiers du test.

Vos principales missions seront :

  • Ecriture des campagnes de tests
  • Implémenter des tests API avec Cucumber et Postman
  • Saisie et suivi des anomalies dans Service Now
  • Analyse des problèmes et support à la recette
  • Préparation des environnement de tests
  • Rédaction de procédures d’exploitation
  • Communiquer les bilans des campagnes de tests
  • Concevoir les scénarios de tests ou scripts de tests automatisés
  • Identifier des pré-requis et jeux de données nécessaires à l'exécution des tests
  • Fiabiliser et rendre plus robustes les scripts d'automatisation

Environnement technique : Git, kubernetes, Jenkins, HP ALM, Service Now, Cucumber, Selenium

La certification ISTQB et la pratique dans un environnement Agile seront des atouts pour postuler sur ce poste.

De formation BAC +5, vous justifiez d'une première expérience dans le métier du Test Logiciel.

Organisé(e) et doté(e) d'un bon relationnel, votre rigueur et votre sens du service sont autant d'atouts qui vous permettront d'évoluer rapidement au sein de Sogeti.

LES PLUS DU POSTE

  • Intégrer une entreprise qui favorise l’épanouissement professionnel / personnel et partager des moments de convivialité entre collègues par le biais d’un CE attractif (voyages, tickets de cinéma...), afterworks et événements sportifs.
  • Réaliser de nombreuses formations : chez Sogeti au-delà des nombreuses certifications nous vous accompagnons sur la partie culturelle, environnementale et mobilité : permis bateau/moto, voyage linguistique, développement personnel, cours de pâtisserie...
  • Favoriser un équilibre de vie : accord de télétravail (jusqu'à 70%), aménagement du temps de travail, accord parentalité, et congés d’anciennetés (8 jours de congés supplémentaires)
  • Un complément de rémunération : prime de cooptation jusqu'à 3500€ ; possibilité d'actionnariat, prime d'intéressement et de participation et PERCOL avec l'abondement de l'entreprise !

3 RAISONS POUR NOUS REJOINDRE :

Qualité de vie au travail : accord de télétravail (jusqu'à 70%) en France et à l’international, accord sur l’égalité professionnelle, la parentalité, l’équilibre des temps et la mobilité durable.

Apprentissage en continu : certifications techniques et formations en libre accès, accompagnement sur mesure avec votre career manager, parcours d’intégration sur 9 mois.

Avantages groupe & CSE : plan actionnariat, PERCOL, CE attractif avec des tarifs préférentiels (voyages, concerts, tickets de cinéma...), remboursement partiel vacances, remboursement de votre abonnement sportif ou culturel et développement personnel (formations permis de conduire, cours de pâtisserie, nutrition...).

NOS ENGAGEMENTS ET PRIORITES :

Le groupe Capgemini encourage une culture inclusive dans un cadre multiculturel et handi-accueillant. En nous rejoignant, vous intégrez un collectif qui valorise la diversité, développe le potentiel de ses talents, s’engage dans des initiatives solidaires avec ses partenaires, et se mobilise pour réduire son impact environnemental sur tous ses sites et auprès de ses clients.

Part of the Capgemini Group, Sogeti makes business value through technology for organizations that need to implement innovation at speed and want a local partner with global scale. With a hands-on culture and close proximity to its clients, Sogeti implements solutions that will help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. By combining its agility and speed of implementation through a DevOps approach, Sogeti delivers innovative solutions in quality engineering, cloud and application development, all driven by AI, data and automation.

json.title: Business Analyst Intern
json.descriptionHtml:
About Qevlar AI

Qevlar is a B2B SaaS startup that strives to massively increase the productivity of cybersecurity teams. We develop AI Cybersecurity Analysts that augment Security Operations Centers (SOCs). Since our creation 2 years ago, we have:

  • Raised $14 million in seed funding led by EQT Ventures and Forgepoint Capital
  • Been incubated both by Microsoft (genAI studio) and Meta (AI program)
  • Deployed our solution to Global 500 companies and leading MSSPs in EMEA and NA (Equans, Nomios, Globalconnect, Almond)

We are looking for a Business Analyst Intern to join our team. You will work directly with the Chief of Staff and collaborate with all teams across the company. You will support executive-level decision-making, accelerate operational efficiency, and help scale a fast-growing AI cybersecurity company.

What will you do

  • Support executive leadership through strategic analysis, KPI monitoring, and operational planning
  • Build and maintain dashboards and analytical models (SQL / Metabase / HubSpot / Notion) to drive data-informed decisions across GTM, talent, and company operations
  • Automate reporting and develop internal tools to enable operational scale, particularly performance tracking
  • Support executive-level presentations and external materials
  • Conduct competitive intelligence and maintain the internal cybersecurity & AI competitive monitoring framework
  • Coordinate Qevlar’s presence at international cybersecurity events, including lead scoring, qualification workflows, and sales enablement support

Who you are

We’re seeking someone who thrives in a dynamic environment, balancing independence with collaboration, and who can bring clarity, focus, and structure.

  • Master’s student or recent graduate in business, engineering, or related fields
  • Strong analytical mindset with experience in SQL and light scripting (Python)
  • Excellent communication skills in French and English, both written and verbal
  • Highly organised, detail-oriented, and excited about startup environments
  • Prior experience in operations, consulting, or startups is a plus

Why join us

  • A high-impact role in a small, international, fast-moving team where your contributions directly shape the company and its success
  • A company culture that values autonomy and creativity
  • You’ll collaborate across many teams in the company and get a front-row seat to the inner workings of a fast-scaling startup, from strategy to execution, and everything in between.

If you’re excited about helping security teams adopt cutting-edge AI, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build the future of cybersecurity together!

Fully autonomous automation for defensive cybersecurity teams (SOC). Explainable AI. Agnostic approach. No playbooks needed.

json.companySlogan: AI SOC Platform That Doesn’t Hallucinate
json.companyDescription:
Qevlar AI is your AI SOC Platform that expands your SOC capacity without adding headcount and doesn’t hallucinate.   

⏱ Investigate alerts in 3 minutes ✂️ Cut false positives 🔥  Focus only on real threats ready for remediation ⚡Deploy in a few hours (the record - 10 minutes!)

Qevlar is deployed in production by Fortune Global 500 enterprises and leading MSSPs, including Orange Cyberdefense and Atos. Are you next?

json.title: SEA Specialist - (Search, YouTube, Display)
json.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950K+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

About

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

  • Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.
  • Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

  • Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.
  • Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.
  • Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

  • Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.
  • Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally
  • Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

  • Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time
  • Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ The SEA Specilalist role ⭐️

⭐ Context ⭐

Alan's digital distribution, both for companies and individuals (freelancers, retirees, etc.), is experiencing strong growth (+45% annually), and we are planning for even more impressive growth in the coming years thanks to a strong brand and innovative distribution.

We are looking to scale our paid acquisition efforts by bringing in a dedicated expert to own and optimize one of our paid marketing channels.

⭐ Your mission ⭐

Your objective is to scale Alan's paid acquisition efforts, in order to succeed, you will:

  • Own and optimize Search, Performance Max, YouTube, and Demand Gen campaigns across all markets where we operate (France, Belgium, Spain)
  • Manage > 1M in annual SEA budget, ensuring efficient spend and strong ROI across markets
  • Test, iterate and scale holistic demand generation campaigns that align with Alan's ambitious goals and marketing OKRs
  • Collaborate with ad platform partners (Google, Microsoft, etc.) to stay at the forefront of paid trends
  • Transform pieces of content into multiple high-impact formats tailored to your channel
  • Partner with our talented performance marketers to create our next top advertising campaign, powered by AI and live shooting at the office
  • Partner within cross functional teams (Eng, Ops, Brand, Design…) in order to scale our campaigns
  • Make full use of AI and automation to maximise operational efficiencies
  • Contribute to define our strategy within the Paid Media team and work on international expansion: adapt and scale winning strategies across France, Belgium, Spain, and potentially new markets like Canada

⭐ If you have some of the following, you may be a great fit ⭐

  • Minimum 3-5+ years of experience in paid search or paid marketing
  • Fluent in English.
  • Proficiency with Google Ads (Search, Performance Max, Display, YouTube) / Bing
  • Strong analytical and data-driven approach
  • Experience in campaign creation, optimization and budget management
  • Ability to work autonomously and take ownership of projects
  • Creative mindset with test-and-learn approach

It is a big plus if you:

  • Are able to work in French, Dutch or Spanish as a second language
  • Have a first B2B experience
  • Have some experience managing multi-market, multi-language campaigns

For this role, we are looking to hire in the B1-C1 range.

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.
  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.
  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.
  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.
  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).
  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.
  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.
  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.
  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

json.companySlogan: You. Better.
json.companyDescription:
Alan is the health partner that insures, prevents, and supports daily.

Founded in 2016 and the first new health insurance player approved in France since 1986, Alan quickly became an essential health partner.

Offering a unique service focused on prevention and physical and mental well-being, Alan uses technology to simplify access to care.

In addition to its insurance offering, Alan provides innovative services like personalized prevention plans, a virtual clinic accessible 7/7, an online optical center, and many ongoing innovations.

These services achieve an exceptional customer satisfaction level (NPS of 68).

More than 710,000 members use Alan across 33,000 companies of all sectors and sizes.

With over 600 employees, Alan operates in France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada.

json.title: Associate Test Automation Engineer
json.descriptionHtml:
At Sogeti, we believe the best is inside every one of us. Whether you are early in your career or at the top of your game, we’ll encourage you to fulfill your potential to be better. Through our shared passion for technology, our entrepreneurial culture , and our focus on continuous learning, we’ll provide everything you need to do your best work and become the best you can be.  

Sogeti

Le groupe Capgemini encourage une culture inclusive dans un cadre multiculturel et handi-accueillant. En nous rejoignant, vous intégrez un collectif qui valorise la diversité, développe le potentiel de ses talents, s’engage dans des initiatives solidaires avec ses partenaires, et se mobilise pour réduire son impact environnemental sur tous ses sites et auprès de ses clients.

Part of the Capgemini Group, Sogeti makes business value through technology for organizations that need to implement innovation at speed and want a local partner with global scale. With a hands-on culture and close proximity to its clients, Sogeti implements solutions that will help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. By combining its agility and speed of implementation through a DevOps approach, Sogeti delivers innovative solutions in quality engineering, cloud and application development, all driven by AI, data and automation.

Whether you are early in your career or at the top of your game, we’ll encourage you to fulfill your potential to be better. Through our shared passion for technology, our entrepreneurial culture , and our focus on continuous learning, we’ll provide everything you need to do your best work and become the best you can be. json.title: Senior Financial Analyst
json.descriptionHtml:
Yseop specializes in artificial intelligence (AI) and is a recognized pioneer in Natural Language Generation (NLG) technology. Yseop is rapidly expanding globally, providing enterprise-level automation solutions for some of the world’s largest companies in a variety of industries including finance , pharmaceuticals and computer software company .

With its multi award-winning Language AI technology, Yseop is revolutionizing the way analysis and reporting is done. Yseop’s powerful and user-friendly t platform allows business users to seamlessly and quickly build and automate the generation of text reports from any structured data.

At Yseop, our mission is to support companies through this digital transformation. We believe that our cutting-edge artificial intelligence technology allows businesses to increase the efficiency of their operations and shift employee time spent on tedious tasks to more value-added and creative work.

So join Yseop and be part of an amazing adventure that is only at its beginning!


Our corporate values drive our daily job:


  • Team : We care about each other, inspire each other and encourage strong team spirit
  • Trust: Trust is foundational. It empowers our employees and customer relationships.
  • Innovation: We love to innovate in ways that delight our customers
  • Customer Centric: We exceed customer expectations and aspire to create true partnerships.
  • Fast: We practice agility, prioritize simplicity and we are proactive


We are building a diverse and inclusive team - and we need your help!

The Finance team is driving the finance operations for our French and US offices supporting the business on a wide range of topics from business planning, reporting and process implementation.

You will report to the CFO based in Paris.

We’re looking for a curious, organized, and meticulous person who is willing to learn and seek opportunities to do things faster and more productively.

This position will work as business partners across our organization to build-out best-in-class reporting, data analytics and workflow processes to help steer Yseop through our next phase of growth.



👩 💻 Your mission

You will be responsible for supporting Yseop day-to-day financial operations, ensuring timely and accurate outputs. You will compile and maintain data needed to effectively monitor and report the status of a variety of financial needs. Other duties will include:

  • Prepare and analyze financial reports: Deliver monthly P&L statements and weekly cash flow reports, performing variance analysis
  • Contribute to budgeting and forecasting: Build and maintain financial models, support scenario planning, and track budget performance.
  • Act as a business partner: Collaborate with functional leaders across departments to define, build, and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs)
  • Ensure data integrity: Maintain CRM and financial data with high accuracy to support reliable insights and decision-making.
  • Enhance reporting through analytics: Utilize data visualization and analytics tools (e.g., Tableau) to develop impactful dashboards
  • Drive process improvement: Identify and implement opportunities to optimize data flows, tools, and internal processes for greater efficiency and scalability.
  • Perform ad-hoc analyses: Conduct in-depth financial and operational analyses to support strategic decision-making.


🧐 Your profile

  • Master’s degree in finance with at least 4-8 years of professional experience in corporate finance/FP&A.
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills: proven ability to break problems down into components and propose solutions
  • Passionate about continually improving existing tools and processes, and enjoy thinking outside-the-box
  • A first experience in a fast-paced environment (fast-growing start-up, top-tier management consulting, audit firm) is a plus
  • Experience with data visualization and dashboarding in Tableau or similar tools a plus
  • Autonomy, accountability, honesty, team-working and good communication skills
  • Level of English is fluent (mandatory)
  • Excellent Excel skills


🎁 Benefits to join Yseop?

  • A very strong company culture
  • Hybrid work policy
  • 1 day per year offered to do volunteer work in an association
  • An on- boarding tailored made to simplify your integration and meet all the teams
  • Team Building every quarter



Yseop is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity is a strength and fosters innovation. We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, social origin, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

json.companyDescription: Yseop is the leader in Generative AI for regulated industries, changing the way content automation solutions are delivered with a human-centric, AI platform. Yseop is reimagining the future of scientific writing to get medicine into the hands of those who need it faster. With a suite of industry-specific applications and technology that blends symbolic, machine learning, and LLM techniques, Yseop ensures that even the most demanding content automation tasks are met with ease, scalability and application security across the entire enterprise.

json.title: Tech Lead Data Engineering
json.descriptionHtml:
Yseop specializes in artificial intelligence (AI) and is a recognized pioneer in Natural Language Generation (NLG) technology. Yseop is rapidly expanding globally, providing enterprise-level automation solutions for some of the world’s largest companies in a variety of industries including finance , pharmaceuticals and computer software company .

With its multi award-winning Language AI technology, Yseop is revolutionizing the way analysis and reporting is done. Yseop’s powerful and user-friendly t platform allows business users to seamlessly and quickly build and automate the generation of text reports from any structured data.

At Yseop, our mission is to support companies through this digital transformation. We believe that our cutting-edge artificial intelligence technology allows businesses to increase the efficiency of their operations and shift employee time spent on tedious tasks to more value-added and creative work.

So join Yseop and be part of an amazing adventure that is only at its beginning!


Our corporate values drive our daily job:


  • Team : We care about each other, inspire each other and encourage strong team spirit
  • Trust: Trust is foundational. It empowers our employees and customer relationships.
  • Innovation: We love to innovate in ways that delight our customers
  • Customer Centric: We exceed customer expectations and aspire to create true partnerships.
  • Fast: We practice agility, prioritize simplicity and we are proactive


We are building a diverse and inclusive team - and we need your help!

So join us to build tomorrow, today, 🚀



👩 💻 Your mission


The Tech Lead Data Engineering plays a pivotal role in shaping the company’s data transformation strategy and ensuring the delivery of reliable, structured data assets from heterogeneous and unstructured sources. They combine strong technical expertise in data processing & transformation with leadership abilities to guide the team towards operational excellence and innovation.


Your main responsibilities will be:


Leadership of Data Engineering initiatives

  • Lead the design, development, and optimization of data processing pipelines and transformation frameworks.
  • Ensure efficient ingestion, structuring, enrichment, and mapping of unstructured data to internal data models.


Technical supervision & team leadership

  • Guide and coach a team of Data Engineers and Software Engineers.
  • Ensure best practices in coding, data modelling, documentation, and delivery.
  • Promote a collaborative and high-performance culture.


Data Transformation

  • Define best practices for data cleaning, structuring, enrichment, and normalization.
  • Integrate and leverage LLM-based techniques to accelerate data extraction, classification, and semantic mapping.
  • Partner with business and product teams to align transformation logic with business needs and domain models.

Cross-functional collaboration

  • Work closely with Data Science, Product, IT, and domain experts to ensure consistent, accurate, and scalable data outputs.
  • Translate business and product needs into technical requirements for data flows and mapping rules.


Architecture & Pipeline Development

  • Design, implement, and maintain scalable ETL/ELT pipelines and data workflows.
  • Contribute to architecture decisions regarding storage, processing frameworks, data quality tooling, and automation.


Quality Checks

  • Implement tasks for data validation, traceability, lineage, and monitoring.
  • Guarantee data accuracy, reliability, and adherence to defined standards and models.


Innovation & Technology Watch

  • Stay up-to-date on developments in data engineering, data processing frameworks, automation technologies, and LLM advancements.
  • Identify and deploy modern technologies to improve efficiency, quality, and scalability.


Documentation & Knowledge Sharing

  • Create and maintain documentation for data models, pipelines, and transformation logic, including AI/LLM workflows.
  • Foster continuous improvement, knowledge sharing, and reusable best-practice frameworks across teams.



🧐 Your Profile


We are looking for a candidate with minimum 5 years of experience in Data Engineering, including 2–3 years in a Tech Lead or senior technical leadership role. You hold a Master’s or equivalent degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or another technical field.

You thrive in a collaborative environment, have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and enjoy mentoring others.


Technical Skills

Data Engineering & Processing

  • Strong expertise in data ingestion, transformation, mapping, and enrichment
  • Mastery of ETL/ELT processes and data workflow orchestration

LLM & AI-Assisted Data Processing

  • Proven experience applying LLMs for information extraction from unstructured data, automatic classification and entity recognition, data enrichment and semantic mapping, prompt-engineering and evaluation of LLM outputs

Programming

  • Proficiency in Java (Spring Boot), Python, SQL, and data processing frameworks (e.g., Spark, Flink, or equivalent)

Modern Data Stack / Cloud

  • Experience with cloud environments (AWS required, GCP, or Azure)
  • Familiarity with data lake / data warehouse architectures

Data Modeling & Quality

  • Experience with structured and unstructured data processing
  • Strong knowledge of data modelling, validation rules, standardization techniques, and schema design

Tools

  • Experience with workflow orchestration (Airflow, Dagster, Prefect or equivalent)
  • Knowledge of CI/CD and version control best practices

  • Management & Leadership

    • Proven ability to lead and coach technical teams
    • Experience in Agile environments and iterative delivery
    • Excellent communication skills, particularly in explaining technical topics to non-technical stakeholders



    🎁 Benefits to join Yseop?

    • A very strong company culture
    • Hybrid work policy
    • 1 day per year offered to do volunteer work in an association
    • An on- boarding tailored made to simplify your integration and meet all the teams
    • Team Building every quarter




    Yseop is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity is a strength and fosters innovation. We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, social origin, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

json.title: Finance Automation Expert
json.descriptionHtml:
Finance & Accounting Automation Specialist

An international company undergoing rapid growth is reshaping its Accounting and Finance Systems landscape. To support this transformation, they are seeking a Finance & Accounting Automation Specialist to drive scalable automation initiatives and process improvements that will enable continued expansion.


Key Responsibilities

  • Lead analysis and optimisation of finance processes with a strong focus on automation
  • Collaborate with accounting and finance stakeholders to document current workflows and design future-state processes
  • Standardise and harmonise finance operations to improve efficiency and consistency
  • Apply technologies such as AI and RPA to automate core accounting activities
  • Partner with technical teams to deliver automation projects and ensure successful implementation
  • Champion change management, supporting adoption of new processes and providing end-user guidance
  • Promote best practices in automation tools and support training initiatives


Skills & Experience Required

  • Minimum 3 years’ accounting experience with solid understanding of finance processes
  • Proven track record in finance automation (AI, RPA, or similar tools)
  • Experience in digital finance transformation and process improvement
  • Familiarity with cloud ERP systems (Workday, Dynamics BC/D365, Oracle Cloud, NetSuite, etc.)
  • Hands-on experience with RPA tools (e.g. UiPath, Blue Prism, Power Automate, Blackline, make.com, n8n, Rillet)
  • Background in automating processes such as AP, reconciliations, and accounting workflows
  • Technical skills (VBA, SQL, Python, .NET, Java, etc.) are a strong advantage


Location: Paris or remote within the EU

Contract Type: Permanent


📩 Apply via LinkedIn or send your CV to

At SystemsAccountants, we connect businesses with top talent in ERP, EPM, and Digital Finance, supporting transformation and growth across industries.

json.jobPosterTitle: Recruiter: ERP, Financial Systems, Finance Digitalisation & Transformation
json.industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Internet
json.companySlogan: Bridging the gap between Finance & IT. We help companies realize benefit from technology investments and deliver change.
json.companyDescription:
SystemsAccountants www.systemsaccountants.com is a leading global Finance Systems, Analytics and Transformation recruitment company.

We provide permanent & contractor recruitment solutions to enable clients to implement, support, develop & optimise Finance, ERP and Analytics systems.

We specialise solely in sourcing, vetting and placing professionals who have a hybrid combination of finance/accounting experience & qualifications, blended with technology (GL / ERP / eProc / EPM / BI / Analytics), project and change management expertise.

Qualitative candidate assessment

We understand that to deliver a truly insightful and qualitative search and selection process it is essential that we meet our candidates and clients in person. We have physically met and interviewed thousands of candidates, giving us a unique insight into their soft skills as well as the technical expertise portrayed in their CV’s or LinkedIn profiles; enabling us to source and present best-fit candidates.

Finance Systems and Projects know-how

Our experienced team of account managers and researchers have an average tenure of 8 years. Our internal training is concentrated on the functionality and architecture of Finance & ERP systems. This is to ensure that we are fully able to comprehend the skill sets our clients wish to hire and in turn, to enable us to critically evaluate the level of technical and functional proficiency of candidates we source and assess. Furthermore we have developed deep subject matter expertise of how ERP and Analytics systems underpin best practice business processes and operating models. 

We have a capability to source and vet finance systems professionals on a global basis and have offices in London, Chicago, New York, Rotterdam & Berlin.

Unlike typical search & selection firms our consultants are internationally mobile, which ensures that our clients and candidates receive a tailored ‘in-person’ service, with the added market insight.

json.title: AI Program Manager
json.descriptionHtml:
About The Company

QSRP (Quick Service Restaurant Platform) is a company dedicated to delivering mouthwatering food experiences to our 100 million customers annually through our 1,200+ restaurants and 7,000 employees throughout 9 key countries. Our product offering proudly represents a culturally diverse selection of Burgers through our US-style Burger King and Belgian-rooted Quick restaurants, French style O'Tacos, Vibrant burger brand G La Dalle, Dunkin: the world leader in coffee and donuts, Chopstix: one of the most recognized Asian QSR brands in the UK.

So, are you ready to dive into a career that's as exciting as our menu? Click that "Apply Now" button faster than a fryer heats up!


About The Position

The Head of AI will lead QSRP’s enterprise-wide Artificial Intelligence program, driving the transformation of the group’s brands into data-driven, intelligent, and efficient restaurant ecosystems. This role acts as both a program manager and business enabler, ensuring that AI initiatives deliver measurable financial impact, operational efficiency, and superior customer experiences.

The ideal candidate combines strategic vision, hands-on program management experience, and strong communication skills — capable of turning AI potential into tangible business outcomes across multiple countries and brands.


These Will Be Your Key Responsibilities:


Strategic Leadership & Governance

  • Coordinate all AI initiatives across QSRP, ensuring alignment with the company’s digital and operational transformation roadmap.
  • Act as the central point of contact between group-level programs (e.g., Internal GenAI Platform, Agentic AI, Finance Optimization, Data Quality Improvement) and regional projects.
  • Lead quarterly governance reviews with the Executive Committee, consolidating performance, risks, and recommendations for decision-making.


Program Management & Execution

  • Oversee execution of AI projects within the 2026–2028 roadmap, including Voice Ordering, AI-based Upselling, Order Accuracy pilots, Pricing & Promo Decision Assistants, and Fraud Detection.
  • Manage and coach the AI Project Lead, and coordinate with regional project managers to ensure timely delivery, synergy, and scalability.
  • Define and track KPIs, milestones, and dependencies across brands and functions.


Financial Impact & Performance Tracking

  • Build and maintain the AI program scorecard, measuring both operational performance and financial ROI.
  • Partner with Finance and Data teams to quantify productivity gains, sales uplift, and cost reductions from AI initiatives.
  • Report regularly to the Executive Committee, highlighting achievements and areas of opportunity.


Opportunity Identification & Innovation

  • Continuously identify new AI opportunities in automation, predictive analytics, and customer experience enhancement across the restaurant lifecycle — from marketing to operations.
  • Evaluate emerging technologies, startups, and vendors to accelerate innovation and maintain a competitive edge.
  • Lead ideation sessions with business leaders to explore new value creation possibilities through AI.


Change Management & Communication

  • Champion AI adoption and culture across QSRP’s brands and regions.
  • Support business units in translating AI concepts into actionable pilots and scalable deployments.
  • Communicate progress, successes, and lessons learned clearly and regularly to all stakeholders.


What Do You Bring

  • 7–10+ years of experience in consulting, digital transformation, or program management, ideally within multinational organizations.
  • Proven experience leading AI, data, or automation programs at scale.
  • Strong understanding of modern AI applications (e.g. generative AI, agentic systems, machine learning) and their business implications.


These Are Your Skills And Attributes

  • Excellent program and stakeholder management skills, with experience in complex, matrixed environments.
  • Strong analytical mindset with a clear focus on measurable results.
  • Exceptional communication and influencing skills, comfortable engaging both executive leadership and operational teams.
  • Agile and adaptable, with a proactive, entrepreneurial approach.
  • Culturally aware and experienced in multicultural European environments.


Why join us on your journey?

QSRP is home to some of Europe’s most iconic Quick Service Restaurant brands. We are transforming the way our restaurants operate and interact with customers through data, automation, and AI-driven intelligence.


As Head of AI, you’ll play a central role in shaping this transformation — leading initiatives that make our restaurants smarter, faster, and more customer-centric every day. Here are some additional reasons to join QSRP:

  • Contribute to our mission of becoming the market leader in QSR sector
  • Plenty of career growth opportunities across all our international head quarters
  • Become part of a company where learning and development is in the heart of the culture
  • Loads of fun initiatives with your colleagues, many of them focused on giving back to the community
  • We believe in a flexible and hybrid work model, but we also offer a modern and cool office environment for you to thrive in
  • Enivironmental sustainability is in the center of the way we operate
  • We care about diversity, equity and inclusion and make everyone feel equally welcomed


Does this sound exciting? If yes, apply now! Even if you do not meet all the requirements, yet have the right attitude and potential, reach out and let’s talk.

Intrigued, but want to read more about us first?

Sure! Check out these resources to find out more about what we do.

  • QSRP website
  • Our Company Video
  • Our LinkedIn page
  • O'Tacos
  • Quick
  • Burger King Italy and Burger King Belgium
  • Chopstix
  • Dunkin'
  • G La Dalle

All applicants will receive consideration for the job with no regards to race, color, religion, gender, sex (pregnancy included) and sexual identity and orientation, age, nationality, citizenship, physical or mental disability, military status, family or marital status, medical condition, or any other basis protected by national or local laws and regulations.

json.companyDescription:
QSRP is a young & creative platform fully dedicated to delivering great food experiences to our 100 million customers annually through our 1500+ restaurants and 7,000 employees throughout 9 key countries.  Our product offering proudly represents a culturally diverse selection of Burgers through our US-style Burger King and Belgian-rooted Quick restaurants, French style O’Tacos, Vibrant burger brand G La Dalle, Dunkin: the world leader in coffee and donuts, Chopstix: one of the most recognized Asian QSR brands in the UK,  as well as sustainable certified seafood at NORDSEE & Go! Fish.

QSRP generates EUR 1,5B in system wide sales within the quick service restaurant sector and is ideally positioned for both organic as well as external growth through acquisitions.  We strongly believe we can position ourselves as a leader within the QSR sector by successfully leveraging our know-how, digital solutions and food technology through the diverse capabilities of our multi-national teams. This dynamic mindset defines our clear direction and underpins the purpose of creating QSRP.

json.title: Data & Process Lead
json.descriptionHtml:
Le contenu du poste est libellé en anglais car il nécessite de nombreuses interactions avec nos filiales à l’international, l'anglais étant la langue de travail.

This job offer is accessible to all, regardless of gender.

Job title: Data & Process Lead

About The Job

As Data & Process Lead within our OPEX & Smart Factory team, you’ll bring standardization and efficiency to Data & Process of Core Model Computerized Systems – ready for AI era. Ready to get started?

Join the digital engine driving Sanofi’s transformation - where AI, automation, and bold experimentation power faster science and smarter decisions. Here, you’ll help build the first biopharma company powered by AI at scale.

About Sanofi

We’re an R&D-driven, AI-powered biopharma company committed to improving people’s lives and delivering compelling growth. Our deep understanding of the immune system – and innovative pipeline – enables us to invent medicines and vaccines that treat and protect millions of people around the world. Together, we chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives.

Main Responsibilities

  • Lead both the Master Data Management process application and the standardization of business process at site level
  • Lead the site Master Data quality KPIs & Site Process KPIs and of the continuous improvement loop
  • Build relevant Data analysis in support of site performance target and fast decision making based on accurate data
  • Manage & communicate the link between site Master Data & process KPIs and site performance
  • Build and develop the Data Analysis capability to support our site digital transformation
  • Manage communication between site stakeholders and Global Business Process Owner

Experience

About you

  • With manufacturing technologies and digital solutions (Ex: ERP, APS)
  • Experience in manufacturing site (pharmaceutical site is a must)

Soft And Technical Skills

  • Leadership – cross fonctionnal & multi-disciplinary teamwork
  • Data driven decision, analytical mindset
  • Good communication skills

Education: Bac+5 degree

Languages: Advanced in English

Why choose us?

  • Power industry-leading performance by leveraging digital, data, and AI-driven innovation – at speed and scale
  • Transform lives worldwide by delivering life-changing treatments anywhere, anytime
  • Work with AI, robotics, and next-gen automation to redefine global manufacturing and supply
  • Be part of an organization that invests in people, technology, and sustainability, leading the industry in low-carbon manufacturing and digital transformation

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what’s never-been-done-before. You’ll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people’s lives? Let’s Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary – together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

json.companyDescription:
We are an R&D driven, AI-powered biopharma company committed to improving people’s lives and delivering compelling growth. 

We apply our deep understanding of the immune system to invent medicines and vaccines that treat and protect millions of people around the world, with an innovative pipeline that could benefit millions more. Our team is guided by one purpose: we chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives; this inspires us to drive progress and deliver positive impact for our people and the communities we serve, by addressing the most urgent healthcare, environmental, and societal challenges of our time. 

Interactions with this account must comply with the Terms: https://bit.ly/sanofi-terms

json.title: Senior Solution Architect Volvo
json.descriptionHtml:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future. If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

What You Will Do

At the AI & ML Foundation, you will help shape the future of AI architecture within the Volvo Group by building and maintaining secure and scalable cloud systems for generative AI, working on innovative projects in a collaborative environment that have a global impact.

What You'll Do In This Role,

You will lead the development and optimization of a modern genAI-powered chatbot platform, leveraging advanced AI and cloud technologies. Your responsibilities include designing scalable, reliable, and secure platform architecture that supports natural language understanding, generation, and multi-modal interactions. You will establish best practices for deploying, managing, and scaling AI models, including large language models (LLMs), and provide technical guidance to the product team throughout its chatbot development lifecycle.

As a subject matter expert, you will advise on architecture decisions, optimize platform performance, and explore emerging AI trends like agentic, multimodalAI, compositeAI… Your work will directly impact the platform’s responsiveness, safety, and cost-efficiency, enabling seamless, intelligent conversational experiences for users.

Who are you?

Core Competencies

  • LLM integration expertise (OpenAI SDK, tool use, multi-step flows, agentic integration, etc)
  • Python (expert level – scripting, backend APIs, task automation)

Azure Cloud-native Development Using

  • Azure OpenAI, Azure Functions, Azure Key Vault, Azure AI Services
  • Cosmos DB and optionally Azure ML, AI Search, or Data Factory
  • Experience with:
  • Building or extending GPT-like apps (chat logic, tool integration)
  • Architecting loosely coupled GPT pipelines (e.g., agentic design, internal toolchain)

Software & Data Engineering

  • REST API creation and consumption (e.g., for integrating Volvo internal systems like MCP)
  • Logs/metrics pipelines (for internal observability and usage tracking)
  • Comfortable in CI/CD environments (Azure DevOps pipelines)
  • Git-based workflows with branching, reviews, and testing

Full Stack Awareness

  • Can collaborate closely with frontend teams using React/TS
  • Knows enough JS/HTML to support GPT UI extensions (e.g., graph output, code formatting)

You are a problem solver, a team player, and eager to support the adoption of new AI infrastructure solutions. Your mindset is proactive, safety-conscious, and committed to continuous improvement.

What’s in it for you?

  • Competitive compensation and benefits
  • Opportunities for professional growth and cross-functional collaboration
  • Work with innovative, next-generation AI technologies in a global environment
  • Flexible working conditions and a supportive team culture
  • The opportunity to contribute to sustainable transport solutions that make a difference around the world

Ready for the next move?

  • Follow us on LinkedIn and volvogroup.com to see how we turn ideas into action.
  • If you want to make a real impact in AI and cloud infrastructure, apply today

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

Who We Are And What We Believe In

We are committed to shaping the future landscape of efficient, safe, and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents across the group’s leading brands and entities.

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, you will be working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to be able to leave our society in better shape for the next generation. We are passionate about what we do, and we thrive on teamwork. We are almost 100,000 people united around the world by a culture of care, inclusiveness, and empowerment.

Group Digital & IT is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.

json.companyDescription: The Volvo Group is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of trucks, buses, construction equipment and marine and industrial engines. The Group also provides complete solutions for financing and service. The Volvo Group, with its headquarters in Gothenburg, employs about 100,000 people, has production facilities in 18 countries and sells its products in more than 190 markets.

json.title: SEA Specialist - (Search, YouTube, Display)
json.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950K+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

About

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

  • Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.
  • Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

  • Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.
  • Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.
  • Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

  • Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.
  • Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally
  • Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

  • Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time
  • Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ The SEA Specilalist role ⭐️

⭐ Context ⭐

Alan's digital distribution, both for companies and individuals (freelancers, retirees, etc.), is experiencing strong growth (+45% annually), and we are planning for even more impressive growth in the coming years thanks to a strong brand and innovative distribution.

We are looking to scale our paid acquisition efforts by bringing in a dedicated expert to own and optimize one of our paid marketing channels.

⭐ Your mission ⭐

Your objective is to scale Alan's paid acquisition efforts, in order to succeed, you will:

  • Own and optimize Search, Performance Max, YouTube, and Demand Gen campaigns across all markets where we operate (France, Belgium, Spain)
  • Manage > 1M in annual SEA budget, ensuring efficient spend and strong ROI across markets
  • Test, iterate and scale holistic demand generation campaigns that align with Alan's ambitious goals and marketing OKRs
  • Collaborate with ad platform partners (Google, Microsoft, etc.) to stay at the forefront of paid trends
  • Transform pieces of content into multiple high-impact formats tailored to your channel
  • Partner with our talented performance marketers to create our next top advertising campaign, powered by AI and live shooting at the office
  • Partner within cross functional teams (Eng, Ops, Brand, Design…) in order to scale our campaigns
  • Make full use of AI and automation to maximise operational efficiencies
  • Contribute to define our strategy within the Paid Media team and work on international expansion: adapt and scale winning strategies across France, Belgium, Spain, and potentially new markets like Canada

⭐ If you have some of the following, you may be a great fit ⭐

  • Minimum 3-5+ years of experience in paid search or paid marketing
  • Fluent in English.
  • Proficiency with Google Ads (Search, Performance Max, Display, YouTube) / Bing
  • Strong analytical and data-driven approach
  • Experience in campaign creation, optimization and budget management
  • Ability to work autonomously and take ownership of projects
  • Creative mindset with test-and-learn approach

It is a big plus if you:

  • Are able to work in French, Dutch or Spanish as a second language
  • Have a first B2B experience
  • Have some experience managing multi-market, multi-language campaigns

For this role, we are looking to hire in the B1-C1 range.

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.
  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.
  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.
  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.
  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).
  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.
  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.
  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.
  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

json.companySlogan: You. Better.
json.companyDescription:
Alan is the health partner that insures, prevents, and supports daily.

Founded in 2016 and the first new health insurance player approved in France since 1986, Alan quickly became an essential health partner.

Offering a unique service focused on prevention and physical and mental well-being, Alan uses technology to simplify access to care.

In addition to its insurance offering, Alan provides innovative services like personalized prevention plans, a virtual clinic accessible 7/7, an online optical center, and many ongoing innovations.

These services achieve an exceptional customer satisfaction level (NPS of 68).

More than 710,000 members use Alan across 33,000 companies of all sectors and sizes.

With over 600 employees, Alan operates in France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada.

json.title: Head of Product Design
json.descriptionHtml:
Spendesk is transforming how finance teams work. We’re hiring a Head of Product Design to lead our next chapter—raising the craft bar, integrating AI and automation into our product, and delivering a world‑class experience across a complex product. You’ll set vision, coach an exceptional team, and partner closely with Product, Engineering, and Data to ship impactful work.

What you’ll do

Vision & Strategy

  • Define and evolve the product design vision for Spendesk’s AI‑driven future.
  • Translate company strategy into a cohesive experience roadmap across squads.
  • Champion trustworthy, transparent AI patterns that deliver measurable value.

People Leadership

  • Lead, mentor, and grow a team of designers and a user researcher.
  • Foster a no‑ego, collaborative culture with strong pairing and constructive critique.
  • Own hiring, onboarding, performance, and career development; hire for culture add.

Product & Craft

  • Stay close to the work—shape key product surfaces and flow for strategic project.
  • Raise quality through reviews, async feedback, and clear guidelines.
  • Ensure accessibility, usability, and visual excellence across the product.

Cross‑Functional Impact

  • Partner with Product and Engineering leaders on bets, sequencing, and delivery.
  • Contribute to strategic initiatives.
  • Represent design in leadership forums with clarity, pragmatism, and storytelling.

Operations & Outcomes

  • Establish reliable processes and rituals (crits, design reviews, async workflows).
  • Embed research, analytics, and decision logs into the product lifecycle.
  • Partner with Eng/Product Ops to improve velocity, quality, and predictability.

What success looks like (first 12 months)
  • A clear, shared design vision for Spendesk’s AI‑enabled experience.
  • Visible improvements in quality, delivery speed, and designer empowerment.
  • Design recognized as a strategic partner to Product and Engineering.
  • A stable, motivated team proud of its work and culture.

What you’ll bring
  • 8+ years in Product Design, including 3+ years managing teams (ideally 5–12).
  • Track record in SaaS/B2B/fintech; B2C exposure a plus for storytelling and empathy.
  • Practitioner‑coach: you can inspire direction and still get hands‑on when needed.
  • Strong craft across UX, UI, and systems thinking; experience setting product‑wide standards.
  • Excellent communication and influence with PM, Eng, Data—and credibility at exec level.
  • Empathy, emotional intelligence, and a steady hand through change.



As we are an international team, please submit your application and CV in English.

About Spendesk
Spendesk is the AI-powered spend management and procurement platform that transforms company spending. By simplifying procurement, payment cards, expense management, invoice processing, and accounting automation, Spendesk sets the new standard for spending at work. Its single, intelligent solution makes efficient spending easy for employees and gives finance leaders the full visibility and control they need across all company spend, even in multi-entity structures. Trusted by thousands of companies, Spendesk supports over 200,000 users across brands such as SoundCloud, Gousto, SumUp, and Bloom & Wild. With offices in the United Kingdom, France, Spain and Germany, Spendesk also puts community at the heart of its mission.

For more information: www.spendesk.com/press

About our people & culture
We believe that people do their best work when they’re given the freedom to thrive and grow. That’s why liberation is at the core of everything we do. We empower Spendeskers to take ownership of their work, to navigate ambiguity, and seize every opportunity. Spendeskers come from all over the world (35+ countries and counting!) but we have plenty in common: we're bold, ever-curious, committed to kindness, and tackle every challenge with a positive mindset.

About our benefits
Our culture is built on trust, empowerment, and growth — with benefits to match!

  • Flexible on-site and remote policy
  • Lunch 60% funded by Spendesk (Swile Card)
  • Alan Premium health insurance
  • A Gymlib pass to let off steam after a productive day at work
  • Access to Moka.care for emotional and mental health wellbeing
  • Latest Apple equipment
  • Great office snacks to fuel your day
  • A positive team to work with daily!

Diversity & Inclusion

At Spendesk, we're committed to fostering an environment where all differences are encouraged, supported and celebrated. We're building our culture for everyone, with everyone. Our goal is to attract and build a diverse, equal and inclusive team, where everyone feels welcome and we truly embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.
