Depending on strategic needs, they can focus on one feature team or address key product concerns across their domains. This is an IC, expert role. Not a management role.You will start with a mission within Customer Success, leading an end‑to‑end AI automation initiative that:Maps and prioritizes the highest‑impact support workflows (from intake to resolution), then designs AI‑first automations across intent detection, triage, routing, resolution, and proactive follow‑ups.Maps and prioritizes the highest‑impact Operations workflows, starting with Customer Support, from intake to request resolutionDesigns AI‑first automations across intent detection, triage, routing, resolution, and proactive follow‑ups to increase operational efficiency and focus our agents on actions with higher added valueCombines LLMs with deterministic rules, human‑in‑the‑loop controls, and safety guardrails; you will define quality bars, escalation paths, and compliance boundaries.Integrates deeply with Salesforce (Service Cloud), knowledge bases, product telemetry, and internal tools to orchestrate smart yet reliable, auditable, and measurable flows.Establishes clear KPIs and evaluation loops ( first‑contact resolution, time‑to‑resolution, CSAT), and iterates quickly to drive step‑change improvements in operational efficiency and practitioner experience.Partners closely with Operational teams e.g. Customer Support, Engineering, and Data/Data Science to scale best practices across markets, channels, and languages—ensuring automation augments, not replaces, human expertise.Who You AreBefore you read on — if you don't have the exact profile described below, but you feel this job description matches your skill set, we still encourage you to apply.8+ years in Product Management with ownership of complex, cross‑functional systemsProven track record shipping AI or ML‑powered workflows at scale, with adoption and measurable impact: you’ve improved operational KPIs through workflow automation.Strong applied AI product skills: prompt/flow design, evaluation frameworks, guardrails, and human‑in‑the‑loop for quality and safety.Proficiency with Salesforce for customer teams (Service Cloud objects, routing, macros/flows, integrations) and data‑driven decision‑making.Now it would be fantastic if you also have:Experience in B2B SaaS with deep understanding of customer support/success dynamics and metricsExperience in implementing AI systems with complex knowledge base management and RAG‑style systems.Familiarity with healthcare‑grade constraints (privacy, data protection, auditability) and enterprise change management.What We OfferFree comprehensive health insurance for you and your childrenParent Care Program: receive one additional month of leave on top of the legal parental leaveFree mental health and coaching services through our partner Moka.careFor caregivers and workers with disabilities, a package including an adaptation of the remote policy, extra days off for medical reasons, and psychological supportWork from EU countries and the UK for up to 10 days per year, thanks to our flexibility days policyWork Council subsidy to refund part of sport club membership or creative classUp to 14 days of RTTA subsidy from the work council to refund part of the membership to a sport club or a creative classLunch voucher with Swile cardThe interview processRecruiter Interview with Maxime Balme (Product recruiter)Hiring Manager Interview with Kenza Ibnattya (Product Director, customer success)Memo & Live-case with Kenza and François Breysse (VP Product)Behavioral Interview with Engineers and/or Care teams from the domainAt least one reference checkJob detailsPermanent positionFull-timeParis Levallois OR Nantes - Hybrid (2-3 days in office)Start date: as soon as possibleIf you would like to find out more about tech life at Doctolib, feel free to read our latest Medium blog articles!At Doctolib, we are committed to improving access to healthcare for everyone. This translates into our recruitment process. We evaluate candidates based solely on qualifications and motivation, without any form of discrimination.The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability.To ensure equal opportunities, we invite you to exclude personal information (e.g. pictures, age) from your applications. If you require any accommodation, please let us know for support during the hiring process.Join us in building the healthcare we all dream of!All information provided is processed by Doctolib for application management. For data processing details, click here.Please contact hr.dataprivacy(at)doctolib.com for inquiries or to exercise your rights.
json.companyDescription:
We’re a B Corp company committed to build together the healthcare we all dream of. 

More than 2,900 Doctolibers in France, Germany, Italy, and the Netherlands are helping to improve the daily lives of care teams with a new generation of technologies and services.

At the same time, Doctolib is helping over 80 million patients to effectively manage their health and provide quick and easy access to optimal healthcare.

json.title: SEA Specialist - (Search, YouTube, Display)
json.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950K+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

About

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

  • Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.
  • Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

  • Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.
  • Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.
  • Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

  • Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.
  • Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally
  • Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

  • Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time
  • Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ The SEA Specilalist role ⭐️

⭐ Context ⭐

Alan's digital distribution, both for companies and individuals (freelancers, retirees, etc.), is experiencing strong growth (+45% annually), and we are planning for even more impressive growth in the coming years thanks to a strong brand and innovative distribution.

We are looking to scale our paid acquisition efforts by bringing in a dedicated expert to own and optimize one of our paid marketing channels.

⭐ Your mission ⭐

Your objective is to scale Alan's paid acquisition efforts, in order to succeed, you will:

  • Own and optimize Search, Performance Max, YouTube, and Demand Gen campaigns across all markets where we operate (France, Belgium, Spain)
  • Manage > 1M in annual SEA budget, ensuring efficient spend and strong ROI across markets
  • Test, iterate and scale holistic demand generation campaigns that align with Alan's ambitious goals and marketing OKRs
  • Collaborate with ad platform partners (Google, Microsoft, etc.) to stay at the forefront of paid trends
  • Transform pieces of content into multiple high-impact formats tailored to your channel
  • Partner with our talented performance marketers to create our next top advertising campaign, powered by AI and live shooting at the office
  • Partner within cross functional teams (Eng, Ops, Brand, Design…) in order to scale our campaigns
  • Make full use of AI and automation to maximise operational efficiencies
  • Contribute to define our strategy within the Paid Media team and work on international expansion: adapt and scale winning strategies across France, Belgium, Spain, and potentially new markets like Canada

⭐ If you have some of the following, you may be a great fit ⭐

  • Minimum 3-5+ years of experience in paid search or paid marketing
  • Fluent in English.
  • Proficiency with Google Ads (Search, Performance Max, Display, YouTube) / Bing
  • Strong analytical and data-driven approach
  • Experience in campaign creation, optimization and budget management
  • Ability to work autonomously and take ownership of projects
  • Creative mindset with test-and-learn approach

It is a big plus if you:

  • Are able to work in French, Dutch or Spanish as a second language
  • Have a first B2B experience
  • Have some experience managing multi-market, multi-language campaigns

For this role, we are looking to hire in the B1-C1 range.

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.
  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.
  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.
  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.
  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).
  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.
  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.
  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.
  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

json.companySlogan: You. Better.
json.companyDescription:
Alan is the health partner that insures, prevents, and supports daily.

Founded in 2016 and the first new health insurance player approved in France since 1986, Alan quickly became an essential health partner.

Offering a unique service focused on prevention and physical and mental well-being, Alan uses technology to simplify access to care.

In addition to its insurance offering, Alan provides innovative services like personalized prevention plans, a virtual clinic accessible 7/7, an online optical center, and many ongoing innovations.

These services achieve an exceptional customer satisfaction level (NPS of 68).

More than 710,000 members use Alan across 33,000 companies of all sectors and sizes.

With over 600 employees, Alan operates in France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada.

json.title: Senior Software Engineer (Frontend) - Design System & Accessibility (x/f/m)
json.descriptionHtml:
What You'll Do

We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our Design System & Accessibility Team and help us become the #1 digital and secure medical companion for patients.

We are part of the Platform domain, whose mission is to build and maintain the common building blocks of our system with a "Platform as a Product" mindset. We abstract and simplify the use of these complex, critical components, enabling product teams to focus on their core mission: building products faster for healthcare professionals and patients.

More specifically, you'll join a team of engineers working on advanced frontend development topics and helping spread state-of-the-art workflows and practices.

As a Frontend Platform team, we support and empower all other Doctolib Tech and Product teams to create accessible and best-in-class user experience frontend applications.

We achieve our mission by providing a web and mobile design system, by writing supporting tooling around it and the accessibility topic, and giving guidance as accessibility experts.

As a Senior Software Engineer, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

  • Design, build, and maintain a scalable React Design System built with TypeScript, ensuring a consistent, accessible, and high-performance user experience across Doctolib’s web and mobile applications.
  • Collaborating with feature teams ensuring that the platform aligns with the needs and requirements of our developers.
  • Work hand-in-hand with Product Designers to translate Figma designs into robust, reusable UI components, ensuring visual and functional parity between design and code.
  • Champion accessibility (A11y) by embedding inclusive design principles into our Design System, developing accessible components, and providing guidance and tooling to help product teams build compliant and user-friendly experiences.
  • Drive adoption and quality of the Design System by supporting teams, improving documentation, establishing usage guidelines, and gathering feedback to inform ongoing improvements.
  • Contribute to the Design System’s technical vision and roadmap, identifying opportunities for automation, scalability, and innovation in UI development workflows.
  • Leverage AI technologies to amplify the Design System’s adoption and developer experience (DevX), applying prompting and context engineering to create intelligent assistants, automation, and migration tools that help developers build user interfaces more efficiently.
  • Occasionally extend your impact beyond the frontend, improving scripts, build processes, or CI workflows that support efficient delivery of the Design System.


About Our Tech Environment

  • Our solutions are built on a single fully cloud-native platform that supports web and mobile app interfaces, multiple languages, and is adapted to the country and healthcare specialty requirements. To address these challenges, we are modularizing our platform run in a distributed architecture through reusable components.
  • Our stack is composed of Rails, TypeScript, Java, Python, Kotlin, Swift and React Native.
  • We leverage AI in an ethical manner across our products to empower patients and health professionals. Discover our AI vision here and learn about our first AI hackathon here!


Who You Are

If you don’t meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!

You could be our next team mate if you:

  • Have 5+ years of experience in Engineering;
  • Have a strong understanding of Design System architecture, component-driven development, and the collaboration between design and engineering.
  • Have experience applying or promoting Accessibility (A11y) best practices (WCAG, ARIA, semantic HTML, assistive technology testing).
  • Are eager to be hands-on with our stack: we use React and TypeScript, with Ruby on Rails/Java backends;
  • Understand the value of testing and code quality as foundations for scalable and robust interfaces;
  • Have the ability to adapt and choose the most efficient technologies to solve complex UX and engineering challenges;
  • Have proven experience developing efficient, maintainable and secure products;
  • Are comfortable speaking English in your day to day with the team;


Now, it would be fantastic if you:

  • Have hands-on experience with React Native or experience building UI for native platforms;
  • Have a great understanding of JS/TS building and packaging processes;
  • Have a great understanding of web application performances tuning;


What We Offer

  • Free health insurance for you and your children
  • Parent Care Program: receive one additional month of leave on top of the legal parental leave
  • Free mental health and coaching services through our partner Moka.care
  • For caregivers and workers with disabilities, a package including an adaptation of the remote policy, extra days off for medical reasons, and psychological support
  • Work from EU countries and the UK for up to 10 days per year, thanks to our flexibility days policy
  • Up to 14 days of RTT
  • A subsidy from the work council to refund part of the membership to a sport club or a creative class
  • Lunch voucher with Swile card


The interview process

  • Recruiter Interview
  • Feature Building Interview
  • System Design Interview
  • Behavioral Interview
  • At least one reference check


Job details

  • Permanent Position
  • Full-time
  • Location: Levallois or Nantes
  • Start Date: As soon as possible


If you would like to find out more about tech life at Doctolib, feel free to read our latest Medium blog articles!

At Doctolib, we are committed to improving access to healthcare for everyone. This translates into our recruitment process. We evaluate candidates based solely on qualifications and motivation, without any form of discrimination.

The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability.

To ensure equal opportunities, we invite you to exclude personal information (e.g. pictures, age) from your applications. If you require any accommodation, please let us know for support during the hiring process.

Join us in building the healthcare we all dream of!

All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click here.

If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, please contact us at hr.dataprivacy(at)doctolib.com.

We abstract and simplify the use of these complex, critical components, enabling product teams to focus on their core mission: building products faster for healthcare professionals and patients.More json.companyDescription:
We’re a B Corp company committed to build together the healthcare we all dream of. 

More than 2,900 Doctolibers in France, Germany, Italy, and the Netherlands are helping to improve the daily lives of care teams with a new generation of technologies and services.

At the same time, Doctolib is helping over 80 million patients to effectively manage their health and provide quick and easy access to optimal healthcare.

json.title: AI Project Owner M/F
json.descriptionHtml:
Req ID: 501135

At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, more than 80 000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

Votre futur rôle

Vous souhaitez être au cœur de la transformation digitale et donner vie à des solutions d’IA ? Relevez ce défi en rejoignant l’équipe RSC-AI, le hub central reliant les lignes métiers RSC, les outils et les équipes de développement.

En tant que AI Project Owner, vous jouerez un rôle clé pour transformer des idées en solutions d’IA industrialisées, en orchestrant la collaboration entre les parties prenantes métiers, les responsables d’outils et l’équipe Digital Services. Vous rejoindrez une équipe d’AI Product Owners gérant un backlog global couvrant l’ensemble des besoins RSC. Votre focus principal sera RSC-Operations (Industrialisation, Supply Chain, Manufacturing), tout en contribuant à la stratégie IA globale et en favorisant la réutilisation des solutions dans l’organisation. Vous serez le chef d’orchestre, reliant vision métier, faisabilité technique et intégration dans nos environnements industriels

Ce que vous ferez

  • Recueillir et analyser les besoins : organiser des ateliers et des interviews avec les équipes métiers (priorité sur RSC-Operations et leurs équipes Méthodes & Outils) pour identifier les points de douleur et les opportunités IA, en agissant comme proxy pour réduire la dépendance aux référents. Collecter les critères de valeur (gains attendus, ROI) pour prioriser les cas d’usage.
  • Évaluer la faisabilité & Make or Buy : tester des approches IA sur des jeux de données représentatifs pour sécuriser les solutions avant industrialisation. Être à l’aise avec Python, les bibliothèques de données et les principes IA pour valider les choix.
  • Traduire en spécifications claires : rédiger un cahier des charges structuré en Capacités, Fonctionnalités et critères d’acceptation, prêt pour le développement par Digital Services.
  • Collaborer avec l’équipe de développement : suivre le développement des solutions, arbitrer les compromis techniques et itérer pour garantir l’alignement avec les besoins métiers.
  • Piloter l’intégration : définir la stratégie d’intégration dans les outils métiers ou via des interfaces web, en coordination avec les référents outils.
  • Suivre l’impact et l’adoption : mettre en place des KPI, analyser l’usage et contribuer à l’amélioration continue.
  • Être acteur de la stratégie IA : promouvoir une approche responsable et éthique alignée avec la stratégie globale d’Alstom, et challenger les demandes pour proposer la solution la plus pertinente (IA ou simple automatisation).

Ce que nous recherchons

  • Leadership collaboratif : capacité à animer des ateliers et faciliter la communication entre équipes métiers et techniques, en simplifiant et adaptant les concepts pour différents niveaux techniques et branches RSC.
  • Expérience en Product/Project Ownership : gestion de bout en bout de solutions IA ou data avec forte interaction métier.
  • Compétences techniques : compréhension des principes IA (ML, Deep Learning), des architectures et des contraintes industrielles ; maîtrise de Python et du traitement de données pour les analyses de faisabilité.
  • Expertise métier : connaissance des processus d’industrialisation, supply chain et manufacturing, ainsi que des outils associés.

Langues : français et anglais courants.

_________________________

(English translation)

Your future role

Do you want to be at the heart of digital transformation and bring AI solutions to life? Take on this challenge by joining the RSC-AI team, the central hub connecting RSC business lines, tools and development teams.

As an AI Project Owner, you will play a key role in turning ideas into industrialised AI solutions, orchestrating collaboration between business stakeholders, tool owners and the Digital Services team. You will join a team of AI Product Owners managing a global backlog covering all RSC needs. Your primary focus will be RSC-Operations (Industrialisation, Supply Chain, Manufacturing), while contributing to the overall AI strategy and promoting solution reuse across the organisation. You will act as the conductor, bridging business vision, technical feasibility and integration into our industrial environments.

What You Will Do

  • Capture and analyse needs: organise workshops and interviews with business teams (with priority on RSC-Operations and their Methods & Tools teams) to identify pain points and AI opportunities, acting as a proxy for business and tools to reduce dependency on referents. Collect value criteria (expected gains, ROI) to prioritise use cases.
  • Assess feasibility & Make or Buy: test AI approaches on representative datasets to de-risk solutions before industrialisation. Be comfortable with Python, data libraries and AI principles to validate choices.
  • Translate into clear specifications: draft a Requirement Book structured into Capabilities, Features and acceptance criteria, ready for development by Digital Services.
  • Work closely with the development team: monitor solution development, arbitrate technical trade-offs and iterate to ensure alignment with business needs.
  • Drive integration: define the integration strategy into business tools or via web interfaces, in coordination with tool referents.
  • Monitor impact and adoption: set up KPIs, analyse usage and contribute to continuous improvement.
  • Be an active player in AI strategy: promote a responsible, ethical approach aligned with Alstom’s global strategy, and challenge requests to propose the most relevant solution (AI or simple automation).

What We Are Looking For

  • Collaborative leadership: ability to lead workshops and facilitate communication between business and technical teams, simplifying and adapting concepts for different RSC branches and technical levels.
  • Product/Project Ownership experience: end-to-end management of AI or data solutions with strong business interaction.
  • Technical skills: understanding of AI principles (ML, Deep Learning), architectures and industrial constraints; proficiency in Python and data handling for feasibility analysis.
  • Business expertise: familiarity with industrialisation, supply chain and manufacturing processes, as well as associated tools.

Languages : fluent French and English.

You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

Important to note

As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

Job Type: Experienced

json.industries: Truck Transportation and Railroad Equipment Manufacturing
json.companyDescription: Alstom commits to contribute to a low carbon future by developing and promoting innovative and sustainable transportation solutions that people enjoy riding. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, Alstom offers its diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. With its presence in 63 countries and a talent base of over 80,000 people from 175 nationalities, the company focuses its design, innovation, and project management skills to where mobility solutions are needed most.

json.title: Product Engineer (Stage)
json.descriptionHtml:
We’re building a browser-based platform that detects and manages SaaS usage across large enterprises in real-time. Our technology combines a high-performance browser extension (300,000+ users) with data processing pipelines that analyze usage patterns, and a contextual notification / conversational system. We operate at the intersection of browser technology, real-time data processing, and enterprise security to help companies control their SaaS ecosystem and guide employees to better software usage.

As we want to accelerate our tech, we’re launching an innovation squad dedicated to exploring new technologies, building POCs, and prototyping cutting-edge features for our platform

About The Role

We’re looking for an Product Engineer Intern to join our newly formed R&D squad. This team is focused on exploration, rapid prototyping, and experimentation. You’ll work on high-impact, exploratory projects—from building intelligent SaaS detection mechanisms to developing AI-powered insights and crafting new user experiences (AI agent in the browser for example)

This is a high-autonomy role where you’ll work on end-to-end prototypes, validate their feasibility, and collaborate with our core engineering and product teams to bring the most promising ideas into production.

You’ll contribute widely to the time to market acceleration of impactful features

Missions

  • Technical Challenges You’ll Tackle
  • Prototype and validate new ideas: Develop quick, functional proofs of concept to test innovative product features.
  • Use cutting edge techs: Apply AI, NLP, and automation to enrich our 50K+ SaaS catalog and improve detection accuracy or behaviours triggers in our extension
  • Explore new interaction paradigms: Develop new ways for our users to interact with our web browser extension, via AI, contextual notifications etc
  • Extract insights from massive datasets: Work with our data stack (BigQuery, dbt, python) to identify patterns and trends in SaaS usage across large enterprises.
  • Balance speed & quality: Deliver POCs quickly while ensuring a smooth handoff to the core engineering team for productionization.
  • What You’ll Own
  • End-to-end prototyping: From ideation and research to developing MVPs and testing feasibility.
  • Exploration roadmap: Work closely with product and leadership to identify promising innovation areas.
  • Technical decision-making: Choose the right tools and architectures to validate hypotheses efficiently.
  • Cross-team collaboration: Share insights with engineering, data, and product teams to inform long-term strategy.
  • Our Engineering Culture
  • Close collaboration with product team to shape solutions
  • Regular knowledge sharing sessions and tech talks
  • Balanced approach to shipping features and improving code quality with best practices
  • Autonomous teams with high ownership and impact
  • Fast-paced environment with rapid iterations
  • Tech Stack
  • Backend: Node.js ( Nest.js ), TypeScript, MySQL, Postgtres
  • Frontend: Vue 3 (Nuxt 3)
  • Infrastructure: GCP, Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, GitHub Action
  • Data Processing: Python, BigQuery, dbt
  • Data visualisation: Looker

Experience

  • You’ll Be a Great Fit If:
  • You're french speaking (native)
  • You are in final year of engineering school (Bac+5) (Ecole Polytechnique, Télécom Paris, Centrale Supélec…)
  • You thrive in uncertain, exploratory environments and enjoy solving open-ended problems. Brain-teasers don’t frighten you
  • You’re a fast learner who enjoys picking up new tools, languages, and methodologies.
  • You love rapid prototyping and can balance speed with technical rigor.
  • You enjoy working with data, AI, software eng. and tech in its globality to create impactful features in our product
  • You want to join an innovative and fast growing company that aims at climbing mountains

To make it clear: we don’t search super experienced persons but innovative minds, that love uncertainty and challenge. You’ll learn in situation!

Benefits

  • What We Offer:
  • Duration: 6 months internship from January 2026
  • Compensation: 1300€ to 1500€ per month
  • Mentorship: Direct guidance from experienced developers
  • Real Impact: Work on actual product features and contribute to the company's growth
  • Benefits: Swile
  • Interview Process
  • 30-min intro call with Priscille (Talent & HR Partner)
  • 1H live meeting at the office with Lucas and another team member

€1,300 - €1,500 a month

We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

json.companySlogan: Beamy empowers large enterprises with full visibility, effective governance, and guided usage of their SaaS landscape.
json.companyDescription:
As a French startup, our mission is to empower CIOs and IT leaders of Large Enterprises with full visibility, effective governance, and guided usage of their SaaS landscape through custom Web Extension and Governance Platform.

The CIO must become a true business partner, not only guaranteeing the security and compliance of the technologies used, but also a facilitator who helps teams to choose and adopt the solutions best suited to their specific needs.

Creating a Technology Playground for every employee is a game-changer, breaking down barriers to accessing and using new technologies like AI, SaaS, and Low-code, and shaping the tech landscape of tomorrow.

json.title: Senior Automated QA Engineer (Playwright)
json.descriptionHtml:
Please note - we don't require Cover Letter, but we want to see you portfolio! Please add it to your applicaction (either by attaching it or by pasting a link in a "Personal website" field)

Company Overview

CapsLock builds exceptional IT marketing solutions for large partners from North America. We don’t just advertise our clients’ products or services — we build long-term marketing solutions within the context of enduring partnerships.

Our people’s diversity and their ideas inspire the innovation that runs through everything we do, from unique technology to industry-leading services and customer experiences. We believe teams that openly support and challenge each other are destined to win.

Role Overview

We’re looking for a Senior Automation QA Engineer who will own the Playwright-based automation strategy and build a stable, scalable testing framework to ensure comprehensive automated test coverage for over 50 marketing landing page projects with frequent updates across all browsers, devices, and screen resolutions using Playwright.

This role also involves providing technical expertise within the QA automation area — conducting code reviews, supporting architectural decisions, and assisting other teams when needed. The position focuses on maintaining and expanding a flexible, scalable automation framework that adapts to frequent changes in design, functionality, and content — ultimately enabling fast, stable, and high-quality releases

Responsibilities

  • Maintain and extend existing Playwright-based automated tests for landing page projects;
  • Develop new UI, functional, and cross-browser automated scenarios based on project requirements and manual QA checklists;
  • Collaborate with manual QA to transform existing checklists into automated coverage;
  • Review and improve the structure and stability of current tests, reducing flaky cases;
  • Optimize test suites for performance and scalability across 50+ active projects;
  • Work closely with designers, HTML-coders, frontend team lead, and manual QA to ensure smooth integration of automation feedback into the development cycle;
  • Analyze failed tests, troubleshoot root causes, and coordinate fixes with developers;
  • Contribute to refining the automation strategy alongside other automation engineers.

Requirements:

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in QA, including 3+ years in test automation.
  • Expert-level experience with Playwright: building, maintaining, and optimizing automated tests.
  • Strong proficiency in TypeScript and JavaScript for Playwright automation.
  • Hands-on experience automating UI, functional, and cross-browser testing scenarios.
  • Experience testing responsive and adaptive layouts with pixel-perfect validation.
  • Understanding of CI/CD pipelines (Bitbucket Pipelines or similar).
  • Experience working on dynamic, fast-changing projects and adapting tests accordingly.
  • Familiarity with code review practices and contributing to architectural decisions for test frameworks.
  • Experience with AI-powered tools to support test automation by generating and optimizing tests, creating test data, and improving testing speed and efficiency.
  • Basic understanding of API testing and integration scenarios.
  • English level B2+

Nice to Have

  • Experience working with Allure dashboards or other test reporting tools.
  • Experience with Selenium as a complementary automation tool is a plus.
  • Experience with Qase or other test management systems.
  • Knowledge of optimizing test suites and reducing flaky test cases.
  • Experience setting up parallel test execution in CI environments.

Why do we deserve your attention?

Not only do we offer fair and competitive pay, but we also provide perks and benefits that support your well-being and growth. Here are some of them:

  • Remote Work - we are a truly remote-first company. You choose where you feel the most productive and comfortable to make an impact.
  • Paid Time Off - work-life balance matters to us, and we support it with paid time off for rest, personal time, or simply doing what makes you happy.
  • Ongoing Learning - we believe in curiosity and growth. That’s why we support continuous learning with workshops, online courses, conferences, and certifications.
  • Home Office - we help you set up your perfect workspace by covering equipment and furniture expenses, so you can do your best work from home.
  • Physical Well-Being - from gym memberships and yoga classes to home workout equipment or even a bicycle, we give you the flexibility to stay active your way.
  • Unlimited Sick Days - your health matters. Take the time you need to rest and recover - we’ll be here when you’re ready to return.
  • Medical Coverage - we support you and your family with reimbursement for medical insurance and health-related expenses, including dental care and psychological support.
  • Co-Working Space - if you sometimes crave a change of scenery or more social interaction, we’ll cover the full cost of a co-working space.
  • Fun Stuff - from gaming nights and fitness challenges to annual retreats at world-class resorts, we make sure there’s never a shortage of fun and connection.

json.companySlogan: Marketing Efficiency @ Scale
json.companyDescription:
CapsLock is a dynamic global company specializing in scalable customer acquisition solutions for our clients. Founded by industry professionals, we help businesses overcome complex sales challenges and achieve sustainable growth.

Our services integrate digital marketing, AI-driven predictive analytics, IT solutions, and sales consulting, enabling data-informed, flexible, and profitable acquisition models. By combining innovation with practical expertise, we deliver measurable results while optimizing internal processes and scaling efficiently.

At CapsLock, we put people, technology, and continuous improvement at the center of everything we do. Guided by our core values- client orientation, integrity, the power of people, and strong relationships - we foster collaboration across a diverse global team fluent in more than 10 languages. This exchange of ideas fuels innovation, driving unique solutions, industry-leading services, and exceptional customer experiences.

json.title: Digital Data Engineer
json.descriptionHtml:
Coders Connect is partnering with Sanofi, and we’re reimagining the future of healthcare through data-driven insights and cutting-edge AI. As part of the Digital Accelerator Data team, you’ll play a pivotal role in building intelligent, scalable data solutions that transform how we engage with healthcare providers and patients worldwide.


Why This Role?

  • Be at the forefront of digital transformation, driving data management strategies that shape the future of personalized healthcare.
  • Work with industry-leading technologies like Python, DBT, Snowflake, and AWS to develop robust data pipelines and models.
  • Collaborate with product teams to power AI-driven recommendations, targeted digital campaigns, and real-time engagement insights.

Your Impact

  • Design, build, and maintain high-performance data pipelines to support mission-critical analytics.
  • Optimize and implement data models using DBT and Snowflake for scalable, real-time insights.
  • Ensure data quality and governance, working closely with Data Scientists and Analysts.



Requirements

  • Proficiency in Python for data processing, automation, and integration.
  • Experience in DBT and Snowflake, optimizing data transformations and warehousing.
  • Hands-on experience with AWS cloud services or Microsoft Azure or GCP.
  • Solid understanding of SQL, CI/CD automation (GitHub Actions, Terraform), and data security best practices.
  • A proactive, problem-solving mindset with the ability to work cross-functionally and drive impact.

Your Background

  • 3-4 years of experience as a Data Engineer in a high-performing data team.
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant field.
  • Healthcare industry experience? A huge plus!

Ready to build the future of data-powered healthcare? Apply now and be part of the transformation!

json.companyDescription:
Coders Connect was formed from a technology community that has a focus on Software Engineering, Data Engineering, DevOps, QA Automation and Data Science. We provide a full hiring lifecycle experience. Everything from talent identification to offer management and most importantly, onboarding to aftercare and satisfaction - with everything in between.

Coders Connect started out as a dev community and now we are brilliantly placed to tap into some of the richest dev hot-spots. We continue to grow in our constantly evolving marketplace. We have broadened our vision and increased our capabilities to add more value to our communities.

Our tech communities are strongest in Software Engineering, Data Engineering, DevOps, QA Automation and Data Science. Need a change? Need talent? Our communities grow every day, our ability to deliver quality at speed is something that has proven valuable to many leading tech firms and technologists worldwide.

json.title: SEA Specialist - (Search, YouTube, Display)
json.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950K+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

About

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

  • Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.
  • Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

  • Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.
  • Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.
  • Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

  • Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.
  • Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally
  • Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

  • Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time
  • Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ The SEA Specilalist role ⭐️

⭐ Context ⭐

Alan's digital distribution, both for companies and individuals (freelancers, retirees, etc.), is experiencing strong growth (+45% annually), and we are planning for even more impressive growth in the coming years thanks to a strong brand and innovative distribution.

We are looking to scale our paid acquisition efforts by bringing in a dedicated expert to own and optimize one of our paid marketing channels.

⭐ Your mission ⭐

Your objective is to scale Alan's paid acquisition efforts, in order to succeed, you will:

  • Own and optimize Search, Performance Max, YouTube, and Demand Gen campaigns across all markets where we operate (France, Belgium, Spain)
  • Manage > 1M in annual SEA budget, ensuring efficient spend and strong ROI across markets
  • Test, iterate and scale holistic demand generation campaigns that align with Alan's ambitious goals and marketing OKRs
  • Collaborate with ad platform partners (Google, Microsoft, etc.) to stay at the forefront of paid trends
  • Transform pieces of content into multiple high-impact formats tailored to your channel
  • Partner with our talented performance marketers to create our next top advertising campaign, powered by AI and live shooting at the office
  • Partner within cross functional teams (Eng, Ops, Brand, Design…) in order to scale our campaigns
  • Make full use of AI and automation to maximise operational efficiencies
  • Contribute to define our strategy within the Paid Media team and work on international expansion: adapt and scale winning strategies across France, Belgium, Spain, and potentially new markets like Canada

⭐ If you have some of the following, you may be a great fit ⭐

  • Minimum 3-5+ years of experience in paid search or paid marketing
  • Fluent in English.
  • Proficiency with Google Ads (Search, Performance Max, Display, YouTube) / Bing
  • Strong analytical and data-driven approach
  • Experience in campaign creation, optimization and budget management
  • Ability to work autonomously and take ownership of projects
  • Creative mindset with test-and-learn approach

It is a big plus if you:

  • Are able to work in French, Dutch or Spanish as a second language
  • Have a first B2B experience
  • Have some experience managing multi-market, multi-language campaigns

For this role, we are looking to hire in the B1-C1 range.

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.
  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.
  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.
  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.
  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).
  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.
  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.
  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.
  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

json.companySlogan: You. Better.
json.companyDescription:
Alan is the health partner that insures, prevents, and supports daily.

Founded in 2016 and the first new health insurance player approved in France since 1986, Alan quickly became an essential health partner.

Offering a unique service focused on prevention and physical and mental well-being, Alan uses technology to simplify access to care.

In addition to its insurance offering, Alan provides innovative services like personalized prevention plans, a virtual clinic accessible 7/7, an online optical center, and many ongoing innovations.

These services achieve an exceptional customer satisfaction level (NPS of 68).

More than 710,000 members use Alan across 33,000 companies of all sectors and sizes.

With over 600 employees, Alan operates in France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada.

json.title: Freelance Software Developer (Kotlin) - Quality Assurance (AI Trainer)
json.descriptionHtml:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates. Please submit your resume in English and indicate your level of English proficiency.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Code generation and code review
  • Prompt evaluation and complex data annotation
  • Training and evaluation of large language models
  • Benchmarking and agent-based code execution in sandboxed environments
  • Working across multiple programming languages
  • Adapting guidelines for new domains and use cases
  • Following project-specific rubrics and requirements
  • Collaborating with project leads, solution engineers, and supply managers on complex or experimental projects

Note: Flexibility and quick adaptation to new requirements are essential.

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You hold a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Software Development, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or other related fields
  • You have at least 3 years of professional iOS/macOS development experience
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • Mid-level proficiency in Swift 5.9+, including SwiftUI, Combine, async/await, and the concurrency model
  • Hands-on experience with testing frameworks (XCTest, Quick/Nimble) and UI automation testing
  • Proficiency with Xcode, Swift Package Manager, and CI/CD tools (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Xcode Cloud)
  • Experience with App Store deployment and monitoring tools (Crashlytics, Firebase)
  • Strong understanding of architectural patterns (MVVM, Clean Architecture) and performance optimization (ARC, Instruments)
  • Experience integrating AI/ML capabilities (Core ML, Vision, Create ML)
  • Practical use of AI-assisted tools for code generation, refactoring, and test automation
  • Strong skills in crash analysis, memory debugging, and performance profiling
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $47/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs
  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
json.descriptionText: This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates. Please submit your resume in English and indicate your level of English proficiency.At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.What We DoThe Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.About The RoleGenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.Although every project is unique, you might typically:Code generation and code review Prompt evaluation and complex data annotation Training and evaluation of large language models Benchmarking and agent-based code execution in sandboxed environments Working across multiple programming languages Adapting guidelines for new domains and use cases Following project-specific rubrics and requirements Collaborating with project leads, solution engineers, and supply managers on complex or experimental projects Note: Flexibility and quick adaptation to new requirements are essential.How To Get StartedSimply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.RequirementsYou hold a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Software Development, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or other related fieldsYou have at least 3 years of professional iOS/macOS development experience Your level of English is advanced (C1) or aboveMid-level proficiency in Swift 5.9+, including SwiftUI, Combine, async/await, and the concurrency model Hands-on experience with testing frameworks (XCTest, Quick/Nimble) and UI automation testing Proficiency with Xcode, Swift Package Manager, and CI/CD tools (Fastlane, GitHub Actions, Xcode Cloud) Experience with App Store deployment and monitoring tools (Crashlytics, Firebase) Strong understanding of architectural patterns (MVVM, Clean Architecture) and performance optimization (ARC, Instruments) Experience integrating AI/ML capabilities (Core ML, Vision, Create ML) Practical use of AI-assisted tools for code generation, refactoring, and test automation Strong skills in crash analysis, memory debugging, and performance profilingYou are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelinesOur freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challengeBenefitsWhy this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you? Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $47/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needsTake part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitmentsWork on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolioInfluence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
json.companySlogan: Be the “I” in AI with Mindrift. Work from anywhere on groundbreaking AI projects
json.companyDescription:
Welcome to Mindrift — a space where innovation meets opportunity. We’re a pioneering platform dedicated to advancing the field of artificial intelligence through collaborative online projects. Our focus lies in creating data for generative AI, offering a unique chance for freelancers to contribute to AI development from anywhere, at any time.

At Mindrift, we believe in the power of collective intelligence to shape the future of AI. Our platform allows users to dive into a variety of tasks — ranging from creating training prompts for AI models to refining AI responses for greater relevance.

Let’s build the future of AI together, one task at a time.

json.title: Business Unit Manager (F/H) - IDF
json.descriptionHtml:
Dans le TOP10 des Sociétés de Conseil en Ingénierie en France, le Groupe SCALIAN intervient sur des activités de services en management de projets industriels, supply chain, architecture et développement de systèmes numériques embarqués, applicatifs de systèmes d'information et d'Intelligence artificielle dans des secteurs d’activité aussi variés que l’aéronautique, le spatial, l’automobile, le ferroviaire, les services, le luxe ou le retail etc.

Créée en 1989, SCALIAN compte aujourd’hui plus de 5500 collaborateurs répartis dans 11 pays et 15 implantations en France pour un chiffre d’affaires de 550 millions d’euros. SCALIAN travaille pour des grands Groupes du CAC40 sur des projets en AT ou au forfait.

Labellisée Great Place to Work, SCALIAN connait une croissance de 20% chaque année.

Pourquoi SCALIAN ?

  • Parce que Scalian vous accompagne dans le développement de votre carrière : programme d'onboarding complet sur 1 an avec votre manager et votre RH, programmes de formation personnalisés, communautés techniques, événements internes
  • Parce que Scalian favorise la Qualité de Vie au Travail : certifications Great Place to Work® et Best Workplaces for Women, prime de cooptation, prime vacances, accord télétravail
  • Parce que Scalian développe une politique RSE concrète et ambitieuse : mobilité durable, actions environnementales, actions handicap (accord agréé, processus de recrutement inclusif, formation des managers et des recruteurs, mission handicap avec temps dédié : )

Description Du Poste

Vous êtes Business Unit Manager ?

Vous êtes orienté-e business ?

Vous êtes rigoureux-se et doté-e d’un leadership certain ?

CDI (cadre) à Neuilly-sur-Seine / Télétravail partiel possible.

5 à 10 ans d'expérience dans le développement commercial et le management technique, idéalement en ESN.

Rémunération selon votre expérience et vos compétences.

Quel sera votre rôle ?

Nous recrutons au sein de notre pôle IT un·e Business Unit Manager pour participer au développement de notre agence locale.

En tant que Manager de Business Unit, vous êtes le garant de la performance et de la rentabilité de votre entité.

Vous dirigez une BU de 30 à 100 collaborateurs et pilotez l’activité à travers une vision stratégique, opérationnelle et financière.

Vous avez pour objectif de faire croître le chiffre d'affaires, optimiser les coûts et assurer un haut niveau de satisfaction client. Vous êtes un véritable leader, garant de l’alignement des équipes avec les objectifs stratégiques du Groupe.

Vos principales responsabilités :

  • Pilotage de la BU

Vous gérez l'ensemble des aspects business, opérationnels, financiers, humains et techniques de la BU, avec un focus particulier sur le P&L (chiffre d'affaires, charges, rentabilité).

  • Management des équipes

Vous animez et coordonnez une équipe de collaborateurs, en assurant leur recrutement, développement et rétention, tout en veillant à la montée en compétences et à la certification des membres de votre équipe.

  • Développement commercial

Vous travaillez main dans la main avec la Direction commerciale pour accroître le chiffre d'affaires et développer de nouvelles offres. Vous êtes également impliqué dans la négociation des propositions commerciales et participez à la stratégie d’avant-vente.

  • Suivi de la performance :

Vous suivez de près les KPIs de votre BU (revenu sales, EBIT, taux d’emploi, etc.) et menez des revues régulières pour sécuriser les prévisions et atteindre vos objectifs de rentabilité.

  • Gestion de la relation client

Vous développez et maintenez des relations solides avec les clients stratégiques, en particulier les grands comptes, et garantissez la satisfaction client tout au long des projets.

  • Innovation et synergies

Vous encouragez les échanges au sein de votre BU et avec d’autres BU pour stimuler l’innovation et répondre aux enjeux de transformation digitale.

Ce que cette expérience va vous apporter

Notre contexte local :

  • Une agence reconnue forte de plus de 1000 consultants dans la région, tous métiers confondus,
  • Des clients essentiellement grand comptes variés en termes de secteurs : télécoms, du bancaire ou encore de l’écosystème aéronautique,
  • Des prestations de type : Assistance technique, Centres de Service et forfait à engagements de résultats,
  • Des métiers variés : Management/AMOA, Software Engineering, Cloud/DevOps, Data/AI, Test/Automation, Cybersecurity.

Qualifications

Ce que nous recherchons chez vous

  • De formation Bac+5 (École de commerce, ingénieur, ou équivalent), vous justifiez d’une expérience significative dans la gestion d’une Business Unit ou dans des fonctions similaires, avec une solide maîtrise des enjeux opérationnels, financiers et commerciaux.
  • Vous avez une excellente connaissance des technologies et enjeux liés à la transformation numérique, notamment SMMACS, ainsi qu'une expérience avérée en gestion de projets et en management d’équipes pluridisciplinaires.
  • Vous êtes reconnu.e pour vos qualités de leadership, votre capacité à fédérer et à développer vos équipes.
  • Votre sens des affaires et vos compétences en négociation vous permettent d’atteindre des objectifs ambitieux tout en maintenant une relation client optimale.
  • Vous êtes dynamique, audacieux.se et avez une forte capacité à prendre des décisions stratégiques.

Informations supplémentaires

json.jobPosterName: Caroline Marcou du Tillet de Villars
json.industries: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
json.companySlogan: Humans and technology to scale up sustainable performance
json.companyDescription:
Established in 1989, the Scalian Group has nearly 5,000 employees in France and abroad. 

It is organized into 3 business lines specializing in Digital Transformation, Digital Systems and Operations Performance.

Scalian has activities in France, the United Kingdom, Belgium, Germany, Spain, Canada and the United States.

json.title: Software Engineer Python (f/m/d)
json.descriptionHtml:
IDnow is a leader in digital identity and fraud prevention in Europe with a mission to transform trust into the most powerful asset in the digital world, empowering enterprises with AI-driven, SaaS-based identity solutions that deliver scalable security, adaptive compliance, and real-time fraud prevention. Through its broad portfolio of digital identity and fraud prevention solutions, IDnow establishes, maintains and enriches trust throughout the customer journey, ensuring businesses can confidently and securely operate while leveraging digital identity to drive growth, security and scalability.

The company has offices in Germany, United Kingdom, Romania and France, and is backed by renowned institutional investors, including Corsair Capital and Seventure Partners. Its portfolio of international clients spans a wide range of end markets including financial services, telecommunications, travel & mobility, gaming, and other industries.

This position is based in Rennes, France.

IDnow, Europe’s leader in identity verification solutions (KYC, eSigning, IDcheck, etc.), is strengthening its RDM (Research Data Management) division. We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer passionate about data and industrialization to design and operate the tools and data storage that power our software and AI research.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and manage data storage and data management solutions for our software.
  • Develop tools and frameworks enabling AI & ML R&D teams to train our algorithms and allowing engineering teams to run product test campaigns.
  • Manage and analyze large data volumes.
  • Set up and maintain backend APIs and services that provide reliable and secure internal data access.
  • Contribute to the industrialization of data/ML workflows (CI/CD, containerization, deployments) with a strong focus on quality (automated testing).
  • Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders (ML teams, product design and development, QA) in an agile environment to prioritize and deliver within a continuous improvement process.

Preferred Experience

Technical Skills:

  • Application development in Python (tooling, services, data scripts, packaging).
  • API frameworks and REST APIs (FastAPI/Django REST or equivalent).
  • Automated testing with pytest; strong quality and coverage mindset.
  • SQL databases: strong “wide database culture,” mastery of PostgreSQL and MariaDB (modeling, performance, query optimization, migrations).
  • Data storage: design and operation of data storage solutions (a major plus).
  • Docker: containerization and best practices; basic orchestration appreciated.

Working Environment

  • Multidisciplinary teams (AI/ML research, development, QA), agile methodology.
  • Internal clients, strong impact on quality and innovation speed.
  • Demanding yet supportive environment,
  • At the heart of identity verification challenges.
  • DevOps: CI/CD setup (GitLab CI), deployment automation (Ansible).
  • Linux: day-to-day administration and tooling (shell, security, permissions, networking).

What You’ll Bring

  • The ability to translate R&D needs into robust, scalable, and well-tested data platforms and tools.
  • Technical leadership on data lifecycle management (ingestion, storage, access, traceability) in service of AI and testing.
  • An industrialization mindset (automation, reproducibility, observability) applied to ML and data workflows.

Soft Skills

  • Motivation and initiative.
  • Curiosity, appetite for technical challenges, and continuous learning.
  • Team spirit, clear communication with diverse stakeholders (engineers, researchers, QA).
  • Rigor, service orientation, and product mindset.
  • English required (international environment).

Perks & Benefits

  • Health & Wellbeing: Use your full access to the mental health platform nilo, including 1on1 sessions.
  • We value personal and professional development: make full use of Udemy, our training platform with 24/7 access and unlimited content/course consumption incl. certification.
  • We make your remote work comfy: we provide support on equipment and offer flexible working hours.
  • We value collaboration & love to come together: regular onsite gatherings, internal initiatives and summer parties to connect outside of work.
  • May your family require your attention or other reasons apply: use the benefit of our paid special leave days.
  • Enjoy the possibility to combine work with a longer stay at your holiday destination or extend a weekend with our Workcation possibilities.
  • In addition to the perks & benefits above, we offer specific benefits that differ between our locations.

IDnow applies the principles of non-discrimination and equality: We strive to establish, maintain, and promote an open and inclusive recruitment process and working environment by respecting the principles of equal opportunities. Including but not limited to: sex, race or ethnic origin, religion or convictions, gender identity, citizenship, marital status, disability, age, or sexual orientation.

Through its broad portfolio of digital identity and fraud prevention solutions, IDnow establishes, maintains and enriches trust throughout the customer journey, ensuring businesses can confidently and securely operate while leveraging digital identity to drive growth, security and scalability.

json.title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
The evolution of technology across the security and identity markets is both deep and never-ending. This is why Linxens ceaselessly invents new technical solutions and has a continuous-improvement program in place at all levels of the company.


Working for Linxens means having the chance to be a part of this innovation!


At Linxens, our employees’ know-how is what makes it possible for us to continually reinvent ourselves as a company and satisfy our customers’ needs. This means that our customers, in turn, can continue to move forward and evolve in their respective business domains, now and in the future. And this is why we invest so much energy in helping our employees hone and expand their skills.


Working for Linxens means investing in your future.


Our growth is creating great opportunities!


Here is a description of the role we are opening:


Key Responsibilities


Talent Acquisition Delivery

  • Manage the end-to-end recruitment process for global roles across business units, operations, and central functions — from intake to offer stage — ensuring speed, quality, and compliance
  • Partner with business leaders and hiring managers to understand business needs, challenge requests when appropriate, and translate requirements into effective sourcing and assessment strategies
  • Conduct direct sourcing and headhunting for critical and senior roles worldwide, ensuring an excellent candidate experience


Continuous Improvement & Functional Excellence

  • Support the definition and execution of the Talent Acquisition strategy, in alignment with business priorities and HR roadmap
  • Lead or contribute to projects aimed at improving TA efficiency, candidate experience, employer branding, and hiring manager capability
  • Maintain and develop the Talent Acquisition Balanced Scorecard, tracking key KPIs and generating data-driven insights to guide decision-making
  • Identify and implement AI-driven opportunities within the recruitment process (e.g., candidate screening, sourcing automation, analytics)
  • Support the development and rollout of training, tools, and guides for hiring managers to enhance their recruitment effectiveness


Collaboration & Stakeholder Management

  • Build and maintain strong partnerships with HR Business Partners, BU leaders, and global functional heads.
  • Coordinate with external search partners and recruitment agencies when appropriate, ensuring consistency and cost efficiency
  • Represent the Group HR function as a trusted advisor in all Talent Acquisition-related topics


Qualifications

  • 5–7 years of experience in Talent Acquisition, ideally in international or industrial environment
  • Proven track record in end-to-end recruitment for both technical and leadership positions across multiple locations
  • Strong expertise in direct sourcing, assessment methods, and candidate evaluation
  • Experience with TA metrics, analytics, and scorecard management
  • Familiarity with Artificial Intelligence applications in recruiting (e.g., sourcing tools, matching algorithms, or candidate evaluation platforms)
  • Proficiency in ATS systems (Workday) and modern recruitment tools (LinkedIn Recruiter, job boards, CRM, etc.)
  • Fluency in English; French is a strong plus


LINXENS is an equal-opportunity employer that strictly prohibits unlawful or unethical discrimination. Moreover, as part of our CSR Vitality program, we have committed to recruit, hire, train, compensate, and promote without regard to an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, mental/physical disability, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
