json.jobPosterTitle: Global Talent Acquisition Specialist at Linxens
json.companySlogan: Opening the way to a better life.
json.companyDescription:
Since 40 years, Linxens is a global player in the electronics industry, offering innovative, tailor-made solutions to the most demanding technical specifications for connectivity, tracking and authentication, to deliver seamless end-user experiences.
Linxens is the preferred partner of global technology pioneers who are shaping the markets for telecommunications, transportation, hospitality, leisure and entertainment, financial services, e-government, access control, healthcare and the Internet of Things (IoT).
Linxens provided over 120 billion micro-connectors and more than 6 billion RFID antennas and employs over 3500 people worldwide.

json.title: SEA Specialist - (Search, YouTube, Display)
json.descriptionHtml:
🐼 Who we are

You. Better. With Alan.

Alan's vision is to make prevention the new norm of care for all. Our mission is to help people live in good health to 100 while helping employers feel proud, turning health benefits from a cost centre into their most valuable investment.

We're building a vertically integrated health partner that seamlessly unites insurance and smart healthcare delivery into one system.

By connecting all aspects of care - private, public, and direct to consumer - we create the most member-centric healthcare experience. Through deep engagement, we empower everyone to overcome day-to-day health obstacles and live healthier lives.

We partner with 35K+ companies of all sizes, serving more than 950K+ members, and have reached 680M+ in ARR.

Our team of 700+ people (still growing) operates across France 🇫🇷, Spain 🇪🇸, Belgium 🇧🇪, and Canada 🇨🇦.

🤘 How we do it ?

About

People joining Alan are always surprised and delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:

🎯 What drives us — We're obsessed with helping our members live healthier

  • Mission is the Boss: long-term thinking, seeking our mission success above all else.
  • Member & customer-led: obsessively focused on solving members & customers problems and creating the most delightful experiences.

🏆 How we build excellence — We hire the best people and give them platform to succeed

  • Champions of excellence: extremely high standards and talent density.
  • Distributed ownership: accountable enlightened despots, everyone owns their decisions and results.
  • Radically transparent: all information is accessible and written-first, so everyone can make the best decisions asynchronously

🤝 How we grow together — We help each other improve through honest feedback and bold thinking

  • Optimistic alchemy: optimists who collaborate with genuine care and support teammates.
  • Empathetic challengers: direct, caring feedback combined with praises to help each other grow professionally
  • Bold & creative contrarians: think differently to achieve greatness, try new approaches

⚡ How we move fast — We fight complexity and focus on what matters most

  • Disciplined in execution: taking decisive actions with focus that compounds success over time
  • Fight for simplicity: only high impact processes, smart frugality

⭐️ The SEA Specilalist role ⭐️

⭐ Context ⭐

Alan's digital distribution, both for companies and individuals (freelancers, retirees, etc.), is experiencing strong growth (+45% annually), and we are planning for even more impressive growth in the coming years thanks to a strong brand and innovative distribution.

We are looking to scale our paid acquisition efforts by bringing in a dedicated expert to own and optimize one of our paid marketing channels.

⭐ Your mission ⭐

Your objective is to scale Alan's paid acquisition efforts, in order to succeed, you will:

  • Own and optimize Search, Performance Max, YouTube, and Demand Gen campaigns across all markets where we operate (France, Belgium, Spain)
  • Manage > 1M in annual SEA budget, ensuring efficient spend and strong ROI across markets
  • Test, iterate and scale holistic demand generation campaigns that align with Alan's ambitious goals and marketing OKRs
  • Collaborate with ad platform partners (Google, Microsoft, etc.) to stay at the forefront of paid trends
  • Transform pieces of content into multiple high-impact formats tailored to your channel
  • Partner with our talented performance marketers to create our next top advertising campaign, powered by AI and live shooting at the office
  • Partner within cross functional teams (Eng, Ops, Brand, Design…) in order to scale our campaigns
  • Make full use of AI and automation to maximise operational efficiencies
  • Contribute to define our strategy within the Paid Media team and work on international expansion: adapt and scale winning strategies across France, Belgium, Spain, and potentially new markets like Canada

⭐ If you have some of the following, you may be a great fit ⭐

  • Minimum 3-5+ years of experience in paid search or paid marketing
  • Fluent in English.
  • Proficiency with Google Ads (Search, Performance Max, Display, YouTube) / Bing
  • Strong analytical and data-driven approach
  • Experience in campaign creation, optimization and budget management
  • Ability to work autonomously and take ownership of projects
  • Creative mindset with test-and-learn approach

It is a big plus if you:

  • Are able to work in French, Dutch or Spanish as a second language
  • Have a first B2B experience
  • Have some experience managing multi-market, multi-language campaigns

For this role, we are looking to hire in the B1-C1 range.

🙌 Perks & Benefits

At Alan, we believe that being in good health is a basic need, and it starts with our employees. This is why Alaners are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy, efficient and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.

Therefore, we offer:

  • Fair rewards. Generous equity packages complement your base salary, for permanent contracts only.
  • Flexible Office. Amazing office space at our HQ, sponsored co-working hubs or a full-remote experience with home office equipment sponsorship, we want you to live where you’re the happiest.
  • All the tools you need. Top of the range equipment: Macbook Pro, keyboard, laptop stand, monitor, and Bose noise-canceling headphones.
  • Flexible vacation policy and flexible working hours. Organize your time as you wish.
  • Delightful healthcare insurance: Extremely comprehensive health insurance - 100% for you and your children, 90-100% for partners depending on your country (permanent contracts only).
  • Transport. Country-specific commuter benefits.
  • Learning & Training opportunities. A highly flexible Training policy free books and budget to attend and speak at conferences if the opportunity arises.
  • Personal growth through coaching: At Alan, coaching isn't just a perk - it's core to who we are. Every Alaner is paired with a dedicated coach from day one, who helps maximize their impact, nurture engagement, and navigate Alan's values to develop their full potential. Learn more about our coaching culture.
  • Parental leave. Extended parental leave for all new parents, for permanent contracts only.

Important note: we hire people, not roles.

If you're excited about this opportunity but don't check every box, we'd love to hear from you. Everyone, no matter how underrepresented, should feel free to apply as it can only bring learnings or success.

If you identify yourself as a woman: Did you know that research shows women often apply only when meeting 100% of requirements?

Remember, this is just a guide, not a checklist.

We'll be thrilled to receive your application!

🔖 Check out our About Alan and Career pages, as well as our Medium, blog and Glassdoor page for more info.

json.companySlogan: You. Better.
json.companyDescription:
Alan is the health partner that insures, prevents, and supports daily.

Founded in 2016 and the first new health insurance player approved in France since 1986, Alan quickly became an essential health partner.

Offering a unique service focused on prevention and physical and mental well-being, Alan uses technology to simplify access to care.

In addition to its insurance offering, Alan provides innovative services like personalized prevention plans, a virtual clinic accessible 7/7, an online optical center, and many ongoing innovations.

These services achieve an exceptional customer satisfaction level (NPS of 68).

More than 710,000 members use Alan across 33,000 companies of all sectors and sizes.

With over 600 employees, Alan operates in France, Spain, Belgium, and Canada.

json.title: IT Business Manager (F/H) - Nice (06)
json.descriptionHtml:
Dans le TOP10 des Sociétés de Conseil en Ingénierie en France, le Groupe SCALIAN intervient sur des activités de services en management de projets industriels, supply chain, architecture et développement de systèmes numériques embarqués, applicatifs de systèmes d'information et d'Intelligence artificielle dans des secteurs d’activité aussi variés que l’aéronautique, le spatial, l’automobile, le ferroviaire, les services, le luxe ou le retail etc.

Créée en 1989, SCALIAN compte aujourd’hui plus de 5500 collaborateurs répartis dans 11 pays et 15 implantations en France pour un chiffre d’affaires de 550 millions d’euros. SCALIAN travaille pour des grands Groupes du CAC40 sur des projets en AT ou au forfait.

Labellisée Great Place to Work, SCALIAN connait une croissance de 20% chaque année.

Pourquoi SCALIAN ?

  • Parce que Scalian vous accompagne dans le développement de votre carrière : programme d'onboarding complet sur 1 an avec votre manager et votre RH, programmes de formation personnalisés, communautés techniques, événements internes
  • Parce que Scalian favorise la Qualité de Vie au Travail : certifications Great Place to Work® et Best Workplaces for Women, prime de cooptation, prime vacances, accord télétravail
  • Parce que Scalian développe une politique RSE concrète et ambitieuse : mobilité durable, actions environnementales, accord Handicap et mission handicap avec temps dédié

Description Du Poste

Vous êtes Business Manager ou souhaitez le devenir ?

Vous aimez superviser des consultants techniques pour générer de la satisfaction clients ?

Vous vous inscrivez dans une démarche d’amélioration continue ?

Vous avez une expérience significative en développement commercial, idéalement en ESN ?

Rémunération selon votre expérience et vos compétences.

Quel sera votre rôle ?

Nous recrutons au sein de notre pôle IT un.e Business Manager pour participer au développement de notre agence locale.

Vos principales missions seront les suivantes :

  • Acquisition et développement de clients :
    • Prospection commerciale de nouveaux comptes,
    • Présentation de nos offres, qualification des besoins clients,
    • Elaboration des offres, négociation et closing,
    • Suivi de prestations, satisfaction client.

  • Développement RH de l’équipe :
    • Sourcing de candidats, avec le soutien de l’équipe recrutement,
    • Sélection des talents en phase avec les besoins opérationnels,
    • Onboarding et rituels de gestion de carrière des consultants.

  • Gestion des affaires :
    • Suivi des KPI financiers : revenue, marge, facturation et délais de paiement,
    • Amélioration continue, adaptation de la stratégie au marché,
    • Définition de plan d’actions pour dépasser les objectifs.
Ce que cette expérience va vous apporter

Notre contexte local :

  • Une agence locale comptant 800 collaborateurs,
  • Nos clients : industriel, tertiaire, banque, médical, e-learning,
  • Nos modes d’engagement : Assistance Technique, Centres de Services, Forfaits à engagement de résultat,
  • Nos expertises dans l’IT : Management/AMOA, Software Engineering, Cloud/DevOps, Data/AI, Test/Automation, Cybersecurity.

Qualifications

  • De formation Ingénieur.e ou diplômé.e d’une école de commerce (Bac+4 à +5), vous possédez une expérience significative en ESN, notamment dans la conquête de nouveaux territoires et le recrutement de collaborateurs.
  • Une connaissance des métiers du secteur informatique est nécessaire.
  • Doté.e d'un bon relationnel, votre curiosité pour les nouvelles technologies vous permettra d’appréhender nos environnements métier.
  • Dynamique et rigoureux.se, vous avez le goût du challenge et avez développé un sens élevé de la relation client.

Informations supplémentaires

Les prochaines étapes :

  • 1 échange téléphonique avec la Talent Acquisition Specialist
  • 1 entretien avec le N+1
  • 1 entretien avec le N+2

json.industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
json.companySlogan: Humans and technology to scale up sustainable performance
json.companyDescription:
Established in 1989, the Scalian Group has nearly 5,000 employees in France and abroad. 

It is organized into 3 business lines specializing in Digital Transformation, Digital Systems and Operations Performance.

Scalian has activities in France, the United Kingdom, Belgium, Germany, Spain, Canada and the United States.

output.job_description: Freelance Vibe Coding Expert role requiring Python scripting for data analysis, automation and verification, working with large datasets, developing AI-driven workflows, utilizing LLMs to improve AI output quality, and delivering well-reasoned, precise, and clearly written technical outputs. Requires a Bachelor's or Master's degree in technical fields, 1+ year experience in AI automation, data engineering or software development, and strong English skills.
output.justification: The candidate is pursuing an MSc in Big Data & AI and holds a Bachelor's in Mathematics, which meets the educational requirements. They have professional experience in data analytics, automation, and scripting, including Python, SQL, and ETL workflow automation with tools like n8n. They have handled large datasets and created data-driven solutions and dashboards which align well with the job tasks. While direct hands-on experience with LLMs or AI frameworks is not explicitly stated, the candidate demonstrates strong data science skills and passion for AI automation, which suggests capability and readiness to learn these areas. Moreover, the candidate's English proficiency and ability to transform complex data into actionable insights meet the communication requirements. Overall, the candidate's skills and experience are a strong match for this freelance role in data and AI-driven automation, justifying a high suitability rating of 85 out of 100.
